english_text: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Qays b. Aslam, from Tariq b. Shihab, he said: The delegation of Buzakhah, Asad, and Ghatafan came to Abu Bakr asking for peace. Abu Bakr gave them a choice between an exterminating war or a disgraceful peace. He said: They said: "We know what an exterminating war is, but what is a disgraceful peace?" He said: Abu Bakr said: "You surrender weapons and horses, and you remain as people following the tails of camels until Allah shows the Caliph of His Prophet, peace be upon him, and the Muslims a matter by which they excuse you. And you pay blood money for our dead, but we do not pay blood money for your dead. Our dead are in Paradise and your dead are in the Fire. And you return what you took from us, and we keep what we took from you as booty." 'Umar said: "I have seen an opinion, and we will advise you. As for surrendering weapons and horses, what you saw is excellent. As for remaining as people following the tails of camels until Allah shows the Caliph of His Prophet, peace be upon him, and the Muslims a matter by which they excuse them, what you saw is excellent. As for keeping what we took from them as booty and them returning what they took from us, what you saw is excellent. As for their dead being in the Fire and our dead in Paradise, what you saw is excellent. As for us not paying blood money for their dead, what you saw is excellent. As for them paying blood money for our dead, no; our dead were killed by the command of Allah, so there is no blood money for them." So the people followed that.
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> سُفْيَانَ -> قَيْسِ بْنِ أَسْلَمَ -> طَارِقِ بْنِ شِهَابٍ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Sufyan -> Qays b. Aslam -> Tariq b. Shihab

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، عَنِ ابْنِ سِيرِينَ، قَالَ: "ارْتَدَّ عَلْقَمَةُ بْنُ عُلَاثَةَ، فَبَعَثَ أَبُو بَكْرٍ إِلَى امْرَأَتِهِ وَوَلَدِهِ فَقَالَتْ: إِنْ كَانَ عَلْقَمَةُ كَفَرَ، فَإِنِّي لَمْ أَكْفُرْ أَنَا وَلَا وَلَدِي"، فَذَكَرَ ذَلِكَ لِلشَّعْبِيِّ فَقَالَ: هَكَذَا فَعَلَ بِهِمْ، يَعْنِي بِأَهْلِ الرِّدَّةِ،
english_text: 'Abdullah b. Idris told us, from Ash'ath, from Ibn Sirin, he said: "'Alqamah b. 'Ulathah apostatized, so Abu Bakr sent for his wife and child. She said: 'If 'Alqamah disbelieved, I did not disbelieve, nor did my child.'" This was mentioned to Al-Sha'bi, and he said: "This is what he did with them," meaning the apostates.
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ -> أَشْعَثَ -> ابْنِ سِيرِينَ
narrators_en: 'Abdullah b. Idris -> Ash'ath -> Ibn Sirin

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، عَنِ ابْنِ سِيرِينَ، نَحْوَهُ، وَزَادَ فِيهِ: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُ جَنَحَ لِلسَّلْمِ فِي زَمَانِ عُمَرَ فَأَسْلَمَ فَرَجَعَ إِلَى امْرَأَتِهِ كَمَا كَانَ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman told us, from Ash'ath, from Ibn Sirin, similar to it, and added in it: "Then he inclined towards peace during the time of 'Umar, accepted Islam, and returned to his wife as before."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ -> أَشْعَثَ -> ابْنِ سِيرِينَ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman -> Ash'ath -> Ibn Sirin

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَرِيكٌ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ مُهَاجِرٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، أَنَّ أَبَا بَكْرٍ قَالَ: "لَوْ مَنَعُونِي عِقَالًا مِمَّا أَعْطَوْا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، لَجَاهَدْتُهُمْ، ثُمَّ تَلَا {وَمَا مُحَمَّدٌ إِلَّا رَسُولٌ قَدْ خَلَتْ مِنْ قَبْلِهِ الرُّسُلُ} [آل عمران: 144] " إِلَى آخِرِ الْآيَةِ
english_text: Sharik told us, from Ibrahim b. Muhajir, from Ibrahim, that Abu Bakr said: "If they withheld from me a hobble rope of what they used to give to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, I would fight them." Then he recited {Muhammad is not but a messenger. [Other] messengers have passed on before him} [Ali 'Imran: 144] to the end of the verse.
narrators_ar: شَرِيكٌ -> إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ مُهَاجِرٍ -> إِبْرَاهِيمَ -> أَبَا بَكْرٍ
narrators_en: Sharik -> Ibrahim b. Muhajir -> Ibrahim -> Abu Bakr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ فُضَيْلٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي مُلَيْكَةَ، قَالَ: قَالَ عُمَرُ: وَالَّذِي نَفْسِي بِيَدِهِ لَوْ أَطَاعَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ لَكَفَرْنَا فِي صَبِيحَةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ إِذْ سَأَلُوا التَّخْفِيفَ عَنِ الزَّكَاةِ، فَأَبَى عَلَيْهِمْ قَالَ: لَوْ مَنَعُونِي عِقَالًا لَجَاهَدْتُهُمْ
english_text: Muhammad b. Fudayl told us, from his father, from Ibn Abi Mulaykah, he said: 'Umar said: "By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, if Abu Bakr had obeyed us, we would have disbelieved in a single morning when they asked for relief from Zakat, but he refused them." He said: "If they withheld from me a hobble rope, I would fight them."
narrators_ar: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ فُضَيْلٍ -> أَبِيهِ -> ابْنِ أَبِي مُلَيْكَةَ
narrators_en: Muhammad b. Fudayl -> His Father -> Ibn Abi Mulaykah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَرِيكٌ، عَنْ لَيْثٍ، عَنْ طَاوُسٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، قَالَ: لَا يُسَاكِنُكُمْ الْيَهُودُ وَالنَّصَارَى فِي أَمْصَارِكُمْ، فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ مِنْهُمْ ثُمَّ ارْتَدَّ فَلَا تَضْرِبُوا إِلَّا عُنُقَهُ
english_text: Sharik told us, from Layth, from Tawus, from Ibn 'Abbas, he said: "Jews and Christians shall not dwell with you in your garrison towns. Whoever among them accepts Islam and then apostatizes, strike only his neck."
narrators_ar: شَرِيكٌ -> لَيْثٍ -> طَاوُسٍ -> ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ
narrators_en: Sharik -> Layth -> Tawus -> Ibn 'Abbas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ دَاوُدَ بْنِ أَبِي هِنْدٍ، قَالَ: ثنا عَامِرٌ، أَنَّ أَنَسَ بْنَ مَالِكٍ، حَدَّثَهُ أَنَّ نَفَرًا مِنْ بَكْرِ بْنِ وَائِلٍ ارْتَدُّوا عَنِ الْإِسْلَامِ وَلَحِقُوا بِالْمُشْرِكِينَ فَقُتِلُوا فِي الْقِتَالِ، فَلَمَّا أَتَيْتُ عُمَرَ بْنَ الْخَطَّابِ بِفَتْحِ تُسْتَرَ قَالَ: مَا فَعَلَ النَّفَرُ مِنْ بَكْرِ بْنِ وَائِلٍ؟ قَالَ: قُلْتُ عَرَضْتُ فِي حَدِيثٍ آخَرَ لِأَشْغَلَهُ عَنْ ذِكْرِهِمْ، قَالَ: مَا فَعَلَ النَّفَرُ مِنْ بَكْرِ بْنِ وَائِلٍ؟ قَالَ: قُلْتُ: قُتِلُوا يَا أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ، قَالَ: لَوْ كُنْتُ أَخَذْتُهُمْ سَلْمًا كَانَ أَحَبَّ إِلَيَّ مِمَّا طَلَعَتْ عَلَيْهِ الشَّمْسُ مِنْ صَفْرَاءَ وَبَيْضَاءَ، قَالَ: قُلْتُ: يَا أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ، وَمَا كَانَ سَبِيلُهُمْ لَوْ أَخَذْتُهُمْ إِلَّا الْقَتْلَ، قَوْمٌ ارْتَدُّوا عَنِ الْإِسْلَامِ وَلَحِقُوا بِالشِّرْكِ، قَالَ: كُنْتُ أَعْرِضُ أَنْ يَدْخُلُوا فِي الْبَابِ الَّذِي خَرَجُوا مِنْهُ، فَإِنْ فَعَلُوا قَبِلْتُ ذَلِكَ مِنْهُمْ، وَإِنْ أَبَوَا اسْتَوْدَعْتُهُمِ السِّجْنَ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman told us, from Dawud b. Abi Hind, he said: 'Amir told us, that Anas b. Malik told him that a group from Bakr b. Wa'il apostatized from Islam and joined the polytheists, and they were killed in battle. When I came to 'Umar b. Al-Khattab with the conquest of Tustar, he said: "What happened to the group from Bakr b. Wa'il?" He said: I said I mentioned another topic to distract him from mentioning them. He said: "What happened to the group from Bakr b. Wa'il?" He said: I said: "They were killed, O Commander of the Believers." He said: "If I had taken them peacefully, it would have been more beloved to me than everything the sun rises upon of yellow and white." He said: I said: "O Commander of the Believers, what would have been their path if you had taken them except execution? A people who apostatized from Islam and joined polytheism." He said: "I would have offered them to enter the door from which they exited. If they did so, I would have accepted that from them. If they refused, I would have imprisoned them."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ -> دَاوُدَ بْنِ أَبِي هِنْدٍ -> عَامِرٌ -> أَنَسَ بْنَ مَالِكٍ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman -> Dawud b. Abi Hind -> 'Amir -> Anas b. Malik

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ سَعِيدِ بْنِ حَيَّانَ، عَنْ عَمَّارٍ الدُّهْنِيِّ -، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنِي أَبُو الطُّفَيْلِ، قَالَ: كُنْتُ فِي الْجَيْشِ الَّذِينَ بَعَثَهُمْ عَلِيُّ بْنُ أَبِي طَالِبٍ إِلَى بَنِي نَاجِيَةَ، فَانْتَهَيْنَا إِلَيْهِمْ فَوَجَدْنَاهُمْ عَلَى ثَلَاثِ فِرَقٍ، قَالَ: فَقَالَ أَمِيرُنَا لِفِرْقَةٍ مِنْهُمْ: مَا أَنْتُمْ؟ قَالُوا: نَحْنُ قَوْمٌ كُنَّا نَصَارَى وَأَسْلَمْنَا فَثَبَتْنَا عَلَى إِسْلَامِنَا قَالَ: اعْتَزِلُوا ثُمَّ قَالَ لِلثَّانِيَةِ: مَا أَنْتُمْ؟ قَالُوا: نَحْنُ قَوْمٌ مِنَ النَّصَارَى، لَمْ نَرَ دِينًا أَفْضَلَ مِنْ دِينِنَا فَثَبَتْنَا عَلَيْهِ، فَقَالَ: اعْتَزِلُوا ; ثُمَّ قَالَ لِفِرْقَةٍ أُخْرَى: مَا أَنْتُمْ؟ قَالُوا: نَحْنُ قَوْمٌ كُنَّا نَصَارَى فَأَسْلَمْنَا فَرَجَعْنَا فَلَمْ نَرَ دِينًا أَفْضَلَ مِنْ دِينِنَا فَتَنَصَّرْنَا، قَالَ لَهُمْ: أَسْلِمُوا، فَأَبَوْا فَقَالَ لِأَصْحَابِهِ: إِذَا مَسَحْتُ عَلَى رَأْسِي ثَلَاثَ مَرَّاتٍ فَشُدُّوا عَلَيْهِمْ فَفَعَلُوا فَقَتَلُوا الْمُقَاتِلَةَ وَسَبَوَا الذَّرَارِيَّ، فَجِئْتُ بِالذَّرَارِيِّ إِلَى عَلِيٍّ وَجَاءَ مِصْقَلَةُ بْنُ هُبَيْرَةَ فَاشْتَرَاهُمْ بِمِائَتَيْ أَلْفٍ فَجَاءَ بِمِائَةِ أَلْفٍ إِلَى عَلِيٍّ، فَأَبَى أَنْ يَقْبَلَ، فَانْطَلَقَ مِصْقَلَةُ بِدَرَاهِمِهِ وَعَمَدَ إِلَيْهِمْ مِصْقَلَةُ فَأَعْتَقَهُمْ وَلَحِقَ بِمُعَاوِيَةَ ; فَقِيلَ، لِعَلِيٍّ: أَلَا تَأْخُذُ الذُّرِّيَّةَ؟ فَقَالَ: لَا، فَلَمْ يَعْرِضْ لَهُمْ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman told us, from 'Abd al-Malik b. Sa'id b. Hayyan, from 'Ammar Ad-Duhni, he said: Abu At-Tufayl told me, he said: I was in the army that 'Ali b. Abi Talib sent to Banu Najiyah. We reached them and found them divided into three groups. He said: Our commander said to one group of them: "What are you?" They said: "We are a people who were Christians, accepted Islam, and remained steadfast in our Islam." He said: "Stand aside." Then he said to the second: "What are you?" They said: "We are a people from the Christians; we did not see a religion better than ours, so we remained steadfast in it." He said: "Stand aside." Then he said to another group: "What are you?" They said: "We are a people who were Christians, accepted Islam, then returned; we did not see a religion better than ours, so we became Christians again." He said to them: "Accept Islam." They refused. So he said to his companions: "When I wipe my head three times, attack them." So they did, killing the combatants and capturing the offspring. I brought the offspring to 'Ali, and Masqalah b. Hubayrah came and bought them for two hundred thousand. He brought one hundred thousand to 'Ali, but he refused to accept. Masqalah went away with his dirhams and proceeded to free them, then joined Mu'awiyah. It was said to 'Ali: "Will you not take the offspring?" He said: "No." So he did not interfere with them.
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ -> عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ سَعِيدِ بْنِ حَيَّانَ -> عَمَّارٍ الدُّهْنِيِّ -> أَبُو الطُّفَيْلِ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman -> 'Abd al-Malik b. Sa'id b. Hayyan -> 'Ammar Ad-Duhni -> Abu At-Tufayl

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْحَمِيدِ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ، عَنْ يَزِيدَ بْنِ أَبِي حَبِيبٍ، عَنْ أَبِي عُلَاثَةَ، أَنَّ عُمَرَ بْنَ الْخَطَّابِ، بَعَثَ سَرِيَّةً فَوَجَدُوا رَجُلًا مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ تَنَصَّرَ بَعْدَ إِسْلَامِهِ فَقَتَلُوهُ، فَأَخْبَرَ عُمَرُ بِذَلِكَ فَقَالَ: هَلْ دَعَوْتُمُوهُ إِلَى الْإِسْلَامِ؟ قَالُوا: لَا، قَالَ: فَإِنِّي أَبْرَأُ إِلَى اللَّهِ مِنْ دَمِهِ
english_text: Abu Usamah told us, from 'Abd al-Hamid b. Ja'far, from Yazid b. Abi Habib, from Abu 'Ulathah, that 'Umar b. Al-Khattab sent a squadron. They found a Muslim man who had converted to Christianity after his Islam, so they killed him. 'Umar was informed of that and said: "Did you invite him to Islam?" They said: "No." He said: "Then I absolve myself to Allah from his blood."
narrators_ar: أَبُو أُسَامَةَ -> عَبْدِ الْحَمِيدِ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ -> يَزِيدَ بْنِ أَبِي حَبِيبٍ -> أَبِي عُلَاثَةَ
narrators_en: Abu Usamah -> 'Abd al-Hamid b. Ja'far -> Yazid b. Abi Habib -> Abu 'Ulathah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا غُنْدَرٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنْ سِمَاكٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُبَيْدٍ الْأَبْرَصِ، عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي طَالِبٍ، أَنَّهُ أَتَى بِرَجُلٍ كَانَ نَصْرَانِيًّا فَأَسْلَمَ ثُمَّ تَنَصَّرَ، فَسَأَلَهُ عُمَرُ عَنْ كَلِمَةٍ فَقَالَ لَهُ، فَقَامَ إِلَيْهِ عَلِيٌّ فَرَفَسَهُ بِرِجْلِهِ، قَالَ، فَقَامَ النَّاسُ إِلَيْهِ فَضَرَبُوهُ حَتَّى قَتَلُوهُ
english_text: Ghundar told us, from Shu'bah, from Simak, from Ibn 'Ubayd Al-Abras, from 'Ali b. Abi Talib, that a man was brought who was a Christian, accepted Islam, then converted back to Christianity. 'Umar asked him about a word, and he said it to him. 'Ali stood up to him and kicked him. He said: The people rose against him and beat him until they killed him.
narrators_ar: غُنْدَرٌ -> شُعْبَةَ -> سِمَاكٍ -> ابْنِ عُبَيْدٍ الْأَبْرَصِ -> عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي طَالِبٍ
narrators_en: Ghundar -> Shu'bah -> Simak -> Ibn 'Ubayd Al-Abras -> 'Ali b. Abi Talib

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ، عَنْ سِمَاكٍ، عَنْ قَابُوسِ بْنِ الْمُخَارِقِ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، قَالَ: بَعَثَ عَلِيٌّ مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ أَبِي بَكْرٍ أَمِيرًا عَلَى مِصْرَ، فَكَتَبَ إِلَى عَلِيٍّ يَسْأَلُهُ عَنْ زَنَادِقَةٍ، مِنْهُمْ مَنْ يَعْبُدُ الشَّمْسَ وَالْقَمَرَ، وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ يَعْبُدُ غَيْرَ ذَلِكَ وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ يَدَّعِي الْإِسْلَامَ فَكَتَبَ إِلَيْهِ وَأَمَرَهُ فِي الزَّنَادِقَةِ أَنْ يَقْتُلَ مَنْ كَانَ يَدَّعِي الْإِسْلَامَ، وَيَتْرُكَ سَائِرَهُمْ يَعْبُدُونَ مَا شَاءُوا
english_text: Abu Al-Ahwas told us, from Simak, from Qabus b. Al-Mukhariq, from his father, he said: "'Ali sent Muhammad b. Abu Bakr as governor over Egypt. He wrote to 'Ali asking him about heretics (Zanadiqah); some of them worshipped the sun and moon, some worshipped other things, and some claimed Islam. So he wrote to him commanding him regarding the heretics to kill those who claimed Islam, and to leave the rest to worship whatever they wished."
narrators_ar: أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ -> سِمَاكٍ -> قَابُوسِ بْنِ الْمُخَارِقِ -> أَبِيهِ
narrators_en: Abu Al-Ahwas -> Simak -> Qabus b. Al-Mukhariq -> His Father

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنِ الْأَعْمَشِ، عَنْ أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، عَنْ حَارِثَةَ بْنِ مُضَرِّبٍ، قَالَ: "خَرَجَ رَجُلٌ يَطْرُقُ فَرَسًا لَهُ فَمَرَّ بِمَسْجِدِ بَنِي حَنِيفَةَ فَصَلَّى فِيهِ فَقَرَأَ لَهُمْ إِمَامُهُمْ بِكَلَامِ مُسَيْلِمَةَ الْكَذَّابِ، فَأَتَى ابْنُ مَسْعُودٍ فَأَخْبَرَهُ فَبَعَثَ إِلَيْهِمْ فَجَاءَهُمْ، فَاسْتَتَابَهُمْ فَتَابُوا إِلَّا عَبْدَ اللَّهِ ابْنَ النَّوَّاحَةِ، فَإِنَّهُ قَالَ لَهُ: يَا عَبْدَ اللَّهِ، إِنِّي سَمِعْتُ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ يَقُولُ: لَوْلَا أَنَّكَ رَسُولٌ لَضَرَبْتُ عُنُقَكَ، فَأَمَّا الْيَوْمَ فَلَسْتُ بِرَسُولٍ، يَا خَرَشَةُ قُمْ فَاضْرِبْ عُنُقَهُ، فَقَامَ فَضَرَبَ عُنُقَهُ
english_text: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, from Al-A'mash, from Abu Ishaq, from Harithah b. Mudarrib, he said: "A man went out seeking a stallion for his mare, and passed by the mosque of Banu Hanifah. He prayed there, and their Imam recited to them the words of Musaylimah the Liar. So he came to Ibn Mas'ud and informed him. He sent for them, and they were brought. He asked them to repent, and they repented, except 'Abdullah b. Al-Nawwahah. He said to him: 'O 'Abdullah, I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: "Were it not that you are an envoy, I would have struck your neck." But today you are not an envoy. O Kharashah, stand up and strike his neck.' So he stood up and struck his neck."
narrators_ar: أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ -> الْأَعْمَشِ -> أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ -> حَارِثَةَ بْنِ مُضَرِّبٍ
narrators_en: Abu Mu'awiyah -> Al-A'mash -> Abu Ishaq -> Harithah b. Mudarrib

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ أَبِي خَالِدٍ، عَنْ قَيْسٍ، قَالَ: "جَاءَ رَجُلٌ إِلَى ابْنِ مَسْعُودٍ فَقَالَ: إِنِّي مَرَرْتُ بِمَسْجِدِ بَنِي حَنِيفَةَ فَسَمِعْتُ إِمَامَهُمْ، يَقْرَأُ بِقِرَاءَةٍ مَا أَنْزَلَهَا اللَّهُ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، فَسَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ: الطَّاحِنَاتُ طَحْنًا فَالْعَاجِنَاتُ عَجْنًا، فَالْخَابِزَاتُ خَبْزًا فَالثَّارِدَاتُ ثَرْدًا فَاللَّاقِمَاتُ لَقْمًا قَالَ: فَأَرْسَلَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ فَأَتَى بِهِمْ سَبْعِينَ وَمِائَةَ رَجُلٍ عَلَى دِينِ مُسَيْلِمَةَ إِمَامُهُمْ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ ابْنِ النَّوَّاحَةِ، فَأَمَرَ بِهِ فَقُتِلَ، ثُمَّ نَظَرَ إِلَى بَقِيَّتِهِمْ فَقَالَ: مَا نَحْنُ بِمَجْزَرِي الشَّيْطَانِ هَؤُلَاءِ، سَائِرُ الْقَوْمِ رَحِّلُوهُمْ إِلَى الشَّامِ لَعَلَّ اللَّهَ أَنْ يُصِيبَهُمْ بِالطَّاعُونِ
english_text: Waki' told us, he said: Isma'il b. Abi Khalid told us, from Qays, he said: "A man came to Ibn Mas'ud and said: 'I passed by the mosque of Banu Hanifah and heard their Imam reciting a recitation that Allah did not reveal to Muhammad, peace be upon him. I heard him say: "At-Tahinati Tahnan (By the grinders grinding), Fal-'Ajinati 'Ajnan (And the kneaders kneading), Fal-Khabizati Khabzan (And the bakers baking), Fath-Tharidati Thardan (And the soppers sopping), Fal-Laqimati Laqman (And the swallowers swallowing)."' He said: So 'Abdullah sent for them, and one hundred and seventy men following the religion of Musaylimah were brought, their Imam being 'Abdullah b. Al-Nawwahah. He ordered him to be killed, so he was killed. Then he looked at the rest of them and said: 'We are not butchers for Satan with these people. Deport the rest of the people to Sham, perhaps Allah will afflict them with the plague.'"
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ أَبِي خَالِدٍ -> قَيْسٍ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Isma'il b. Abi Khalid -> Qays

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ جَدِّهِ، قَالَ: كَتَبَ عَمْرُو بْنُ الْعَاصِ إِلَى عُمَرَ بْنِ الْخَطَّابِ أَنَّ رَجُلًا يُبَدِّلُ بِالْكُفْرِ بَعْدَ الْإِيمَانِ، فَكَتَبَ إِلَيْهِ عُمَرُ: اسْتَتِبْهُ، فَإِنْ تَابَ فَاقْبَلْ مِنْهُ، وَإِلَّا فَاضْرِبْ عُنُقَهُ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman told us, from Hajjaj, from 'Amr b. Shu'ayb, from his father, from his grandfather, he said: 'Amr b. Al-'As wrote to 'Umar b. Al-Khattab that a man exchanges disbelief after faith. 'Umar wrote to him: "Ask him to repent. If he repents, accept it from him; otherwise, strike his neck."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ -> حَجَّاجٍ -> عَمْرِو بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ -> أَبِيهِ -> جَدِّهِ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman -> Hajjaj -> 'Amr b. Shu'ayb -> His Father -> His Grandfather

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ عُبَيْدٍ الْعَامِرِيِّ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، قَالَ: كَانَ أُنَاسٌ يَأْخُذُونَ الْعَطَاءَ وَالرِّزْقَ وَيُصَلُّونَ مَعَ النَّاسِ، وَكَانُوا يَعْبُدُونَ الْأَصْنَامَ فِي السِّرِّ، فَأَتَى بِهِمْ عَلِيُّ بْنُ أَبِي طَالِبٍ فَوَضَعَهُمْ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ، أَوْ قَالَ: "فِي السِّجْنِ، ثُمَّ قَالَ: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ مَا تَرَوْنَ فِي قَوْمٍ كَانُوا يَأْخُذُونَ مَعَكُمُ الْعَطَاءَ وَالرِّزْقَ وَيَعْبُدُونَ هَذِهِ الْأَصْنَامَ؟ قَالَ النَّاسُ: اقْتُلْهُمْ قَالَ: لَا، وَلَكِنْ أَصْنَعُ بِهِمْ كَمَا صَنَعُوا بِأَبِينَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ، فَحَرَّقَهُمْ بِالنَّارِ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman told us, from 'Abd al-Rahman b. 'Ubayd Al-'Amiri, from his father, he said: "There were people who took the stipend and provision and prayed with the people, but they worshipped idols in secret. 'Ali b. Abi Talib brought them and placed them in the mosque" - or he said: "in prison - then he said: 'O people, what do you say about people who were taking the stipend and provision with you and worshipping these idols?' The people said: 'Kill them.' He said: 'No, but I will do with them as they did with our father Abraham.' So he burned them with fire."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ -> عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ عُبَيْدٍ الْعَامِرِيِّ -> أَبِيهِ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman -> 'Abd al-Rahman b. 'Ubayd Al-'Amiri -> His Father

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا الْبَكْرَاوِيُّ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُمَرَ، قَالَ: كَتَبَ عُمَرُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ فِي قَوْمٍ نَصَارَى ارْتَدُّوا، فَكَتَبَ: أَنِ اسْتَتِيبُوهُمْ، فَإِنْ تَابُوا وَإِلَّا فَاقْتُلُوهُمْ
english_text: Al-Bakrawi told us, from 'Abdullah b. 'Umar, he said: 'Umar b. 'Abd al-'Aziz wrote regarding a group of Christians who apostatized. He wrote: "Ask them to repent. If they repent, [good]; otherwise, kill them."
narrators_ar: الْبَكْرَاوِيُّ -> عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Al-Bakrawi -> 'Abdullah b. 'Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، فِي الْمُرْتَدِّ يُسْتَتَابُ، فَإِنْ تَابَ تُرِكَ وَإِنْ أَبَى قُتِلَ
english_text: Hushaym told us, from Mughirah, from Ibrahim, regarding the apostate: he is asked to repent. If he repents, he is left alone; and if he refuses, he is killed.
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ -> مُغِيرَةَ -> إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Hushaym -> Mughirah -> Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ بَكْرٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنِي عَمْرُو بْنُ دِينَارٍ، فِي الرَّجُلِ كَفَرَ بَعْدَ إِيمَانِهِ قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ عُبَيْدَ بْنَ عُمَيْرٍ يَقُولُ: يُقْتَلُ
english_text: Muhammad b. Bakr told us, from Ibn Jurayj, he said: 'Amr b. Dinar informed me regarding a man who disbelieved after his faith. He said: I heard 'Ubayd b. 'Umayr say: "He is killed."
narrators_ar: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ بَكْرٍ -> ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ -> عَمْرُو بْنُ دِينَارٍ -> عُبَيْدَ بْنَ عُمَيْرٍ
narrators_en: Muhammad b. Bakr -> Ibn Jurayj -> 'Amr b. Dinar -> 'Ubayd b. 'Umayr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ بَكْرٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، قَالَ: قَالَ عَطَاءٌ فِي الْإِنْسَانِ يَكْفُرُ بَعْدَ إِيمَانِهِ: يُدْعَى إِلَى الْإِسْلَامِ، فَإِنْ أَبَى قُتِلَ
english_text: Muhammad b. Bakr told us, from Ibn Jurayj, he said: 'Ata' said regarding a person who disbelieves after his faith: "He is invited to Islam. If he refuses, he is killed."
narrators_ar: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ بَكْرٍ -> ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ -> عَطَاءٌ
narrators_en: Muhammad b. Bakr -> Ibn Jurayj -> 'Ata'

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ أَبِي بُرْدَةَ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ "أَبِي مُوسَى، قَالَ:" بَعَثَنِي رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، أَنَا وَمُعَاذٌ إِلَى الْيَمَنِ، قَالَ: فَأَتَانِي يَوْمًا وَعِنْدِي يَهُودِيٌّ قَدْ كَانَ مُسْلِمًا فَرَجَعَ عَنِ الْإِسْلَامِ إِلَى الْيَهُودِيَّةِ فَقَالَ: لَا أَنْزِلُ حَتَّى تَضْرِبَ عُنُقَهُ، قَالَ حَجَّاجٌ: وَحَدَّثَنِي قَتَادَةُ أَنَّ أَبَا مُوسَى قَدْ كَانَ دَعَاهُ أَرْبَعِينَ يَوْمًا
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman told us, from Hajjaj, from Sa'id b. Abi Burdah, from his father, from Abu Musa, he said: "The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, sent me and Mu'adh to Yemen. He said: He came to me one day while I had with me a Jew who had been a Muslim but reverted from Islam to Judaism. He said: 'I will not dismount until you strike his neck.'" Hajjaj said: And Qatadah told me that Abu Musa had invited him [to repent] for forty days.
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ -> حَجَّاجٍ -> سَعِيدِ بْنِ أَبِي بُرْدَةَ -> أَبِيهِ -> أَبِي مُوسَى
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman -> Hajjaj -> Sa'id b. Abi Burdah -> His Father -> Abu Musa

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ شَيْبَانَ النَّحْوِيِّ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ أَبِي كَثِيرٍ، عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ ثَوْبَانَ، "أَنَّ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ قَالَ فِي آخِرِ خُطْبَةٍ خَطَبَهَا: إِنَّ هَذِهِ الْقَرْيَةَ، يَعْنِي الْمَدِينَةَ لَا يَصْلُحُ فِيهَا مِلَّتَانِ، فَأَيُّمَا نَصْرَانِيٌّ أَسْلَمَ، ثُمَّ تَنَصَّرَ فَاضْرِبُوا عُنُقَهُ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman told us, from Shayban An-Nahwi, from Yahya b. Abi Kathir, from Muhammad b. 'Abd al-Rahman b. Thawban, "that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said in the last sermon he delivered: 'Indeed, this village, meaning Madinah, two religions are not suitable in it. So any Christian who accepts Islam then converts back to Christianity, strike his neck.'"
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ -> شَيْبَانَ النَّحْوِيِّ -> يَحْيَى بْنِ أَبِي كَثِيرٍ -> مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ ثَوْبَانَ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman -> Shayban An-Nahwi -> Yahya b. Abi Kathir -> Muhammad b. 'Abd al-Rahman b. Thawban

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ قَيْسٍ، عَمَّنْ سَمِعَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، يَقُولُ: يُسْتَتَابُ الْمُرْتَدُّ كُلَّمَا ارْتَدَّ
english_text: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from 'Amr b. Qays, from someone who heard Ibrahim say: "The apostate is asked to repent every time he apostatizes."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> سُفْيَانَ -> عَمْرِو بْنِ قَيْسٍ -> إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Sufyan -> 'Amr b. Qays -> Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَبَابَةُ، قَالَ ثنا ابْنُ أَبِي ذِئْبٍ، عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُتْبَةَ، قَالَ: كَانَ نَاسٌ مِنْ بَنِي حَنِيفَةَ مِمَّنْ كَانُوا مَعَ مُسَيْلِمَةَ الْكَذَّابِ يُفْشُونَ أَحَادِيثَهُ وَيَتْلُونَهَا فَأَخَذَهُمْ ابْنُ مَسْعُودٍ إِلَى عُثْمَانَ فَكَتَبَ إِلَيْهِ عُثْمَانُ أَنْ ادْعُهُمْ إِلَى الْإِسْلَامِ، فَمَنْ شَهِدَ مِنْهُمْ أَنْ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، وَاخْتَارَ الْإِيمَانَ عَلَى الْكُفْرِ فَاقْبَلْ ذَلِكَ مِنْهُمْ وَخَلِّ سَبِيلَهُمْ، فَإِنْ أَبَوْا فَاضْرِبْ أَعْنَاقَهُمْ، فَاسْتَتَابَهُمْ، فَتَابَ بَعْضُهُمْ وَأَبَى بَعْضُهُمْ، فَضَرَبَ أَعْنَاقَ الَّذِينَ أَبَوْا
english_text: Shababah told us, he said: Ibn Abi Dhi'b told us, from Az-Zuhri, from 'Ubayd Allah b. 'Abdullah b. 'Utbah, he said: There were people from Banu Hanifah who were with Musaylimah the Liar, spreading his sayings and reciting them. Ibn Mas'ud seized them and [wrote] to 'Uthman. 'Uthman wrote to him: "Invite them to Islam. Whoever among them testifies that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and chooses faith over disbelief, accept that from them and let them go. If they refuse, strike their necks." So he asked them to repent; some of them repented and some refused. So he struck the necks of those who refused.
narrators_ar: شَبَابَةُ -> ابْنُ أَبِي ذِئْبٍ -> الزُّهْرِيِّ -> عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُتْبَةَ
narrators_en: Shababah -> Ibn Abi Dhi'b -> Az-Zuhri -> 'Ubayd Allah b. 'Abdullah b. 'Utbah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ، عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، قَالَ: "لَمَّا قَدِمَ عَلَى عُمَرَ فَتْحُ تُسْتَرَ وَتُسْتَرُ مِنْ أَرْضِ الْبَصْرَةِ سَأَلَهُمْ: هَلْ مِنْ مُغَرِّبَةٍ؟، قَالُوا: رَجُلٌ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ لَحِقَ بِالْمُشْرِكِينَ فَأَخَذْنَاهُ، قَالَ: مَا صَنَعْتُمْ بِهِ؟ قَالُوا: قَتَلْنَاهُ، قَالَ: أَفَلَا أَدْخَلْتُمُوهُ بَيْتًا وَأَغْلَقْتُمْ عَلَيْهِ بَابًا وَأَطْعَمْتُمُوهُ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ رَغِيفًا ثُمَّ اسْتَتَبْتُمُوهُ ثَلَاثًا، فَإِنْ تَابَ وَإِلَّا قَتَلْتُمُوهُ، ثُمَّ قَالَ: اللَّهُمَّ لَمْ أَشْهَدْ وَلَمْ آمُرْ وَلَمْ أَرْضَ إِذَا بَلَغَنِي أَوْ قَالَ: حِينَ بَلَغَنِي
english_text: Ibn 'Uyaynah told us, from Muhammad b. 'Abd al-Rahman, from his father, he said: "When the conquest of Tustar came to 'Umar - and Tustar is from the land of Basra - he asked them: 'Are there any estranged ones (Mugharribah)?' They said: 'A man from the Muslims joined the polytheists, and we caught him.' He said: 'What did you do with him?' They said: 'We killed him.' He said: 'Why didn't you put him in a house, lock the door on him, feed him a loaf of bread every day, then ask him to repent for three days? If he repented, [good]; otherwise, you kill him.' Then he said: 'O Allah, I did not witness, I did not command, and I did not approve when it reached me' - or he said: 'at the time it reached me.'"
narrators_ar: ابْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ -> مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ -> أَبِيهِ
narrators_en: Ibn 'Uyaynah -> Muhammad b. 'Abd al-Rahman -> His Father

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُعَاذُ بْنُ مُعَاذٍ، قَالَ ثنا ابْنُ جُرَيْجٍ، عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ مُوسَى، عَنْ عُثْمَانَ، قَالَ: يُسْتَتَابُ الْمُرْتَدُّ ثَلَاثًا
english_text: Mu'adh b. Mu'adh told us, he said: Ibn Jurayj told us, from Sulayman b. Musa, from 'Uthman, he said: "The apostate is asked to repent three times."
narrators_ar: مُعَاذُ بْنُ مُعَاذٍ -> ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ -> سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ مُوسَى -> عُثْمَانَ
narrators_en: Mu'adh b. Mu'adh -> Ibn Jurayj -> Sulayman b. Musa -> 'Uthman

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُعَاذُ بْنُ بَكْرٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، عَنْ حَيَّانَ، عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ، قَالَ: يُدْعَى إِلَى الْإِسْلَامِ ثَلَاثَ مِرَارٍ، فَإِنْ أَبَى ضُرِبَتْ عُنُقُهُ
english_text: Mu'adh b. Bakr told us, from Ibn Jurayj, from Hayyan, from Az-Zuhri, he said: "He is invited to Islam three times. If he refuses, his neck is struck."
narrators_ar: مُعَاذُ بْنُ بَكْرٍ -> ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ -> حَيَّانَ -> الزُّهْرِيِّ
narrators_en: Mu'adh b. Bakr -> Ibn Jurayj -> Hayyan -> Az-Zuhri

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ جَابِرٍ، عَنْ عَامِرٍ، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ، قَالَ: يُسْتَتَابُ الْمُرْتَدُّ ثَلَاثًا
english_text: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Jabir, from 'Amir, from 'Ali, he said: "The apostate is asked to repent three times."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> سُفْيَانَ -> جَابِرٍ -> عَامِرٍ -> عَلِيٍّ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Sufyan -> Jabir -> 'Amir -> 'Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، قَالَ: قَالَ عَلِيٌّ: يُسْتَتَابُ الْمُرْتَدُّ ثَلَاثًا، فَإِنْ عَادَ قُتِلَ
english_text: Hafs told us, from Ash'ath, from Al-Sha'bi, he said: 'Ali said: "The apostate is asked to repent three times. If he returns [to disbelief], he is killed."
narrators_ar: حَفْصٌ -> أَشْعَثَ -> الشَّعْبِيِّ -> عَلِيٌّ
narrators_en: Hafs -> Ash'ath -> Al-Sha'bi -> 'Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْكَرِيمِ، عَمَّنْ سَمِعَ ابْنَ عُمَرَ، يَقُولُ: يُسْتَتَابُ الْمُرْتَدُّ ثَلَاثًا
english_text: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from 'Abd al-Karim, from someone who heard Ibn 'Umar say: "The apostate is asked to repent three times."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> سُفْيَانَ -> عَبْدِ الْكَرِيمِ -> ابْنَ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Sufyan -> 'Abd al-Karim -> Ibn 'Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ فُضَيْلٍ، عَنِ الْوَلِيدِ بْنِ جُمَيْعٍ، قَالَ: كَتَبَ عَامِلٌ لِعُمَرَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ مِنَ الْيَمَنِ أَنَّ رَجُلًا كَانَ يَهُودِيًّا فَأَسْلَمَ ثُمَّ تَهَوَّدَ فَرَجَعَ عَنِ الْإِسْلَامِ، فَكَتَبَ إِلَيْهِ عُمَرُ: أَنِ ادْعُهُ إِلَى الْإِسْلَامِ، فَإِنْ أَسْلَمَ فَخَلِّ سَبِيلَهُ، وَإِنْ أَبَى فَادْعُهُ بِالْحَسَنَةِ، ثُمَّ ادْعُهُ فَإِنْ أَبَى فَاضْمُمْهُ عَلَيْهَا، فَإِنْ أَبَى فَأَوْثِقْهُ ثُمَّ ضَعْ الْخَشَبَةَ عَلَى قَلْبِهِ، ثُمَّ ادْعُهُ، فَإِنْ رَجَعَ فَخَلِّ سَبِيلَهُ، وَإِنْ أَبَى فَاقْتُلْهُ، فَلَمَّا جَاءَ الْكِتَابُ فَعَلَ بِهِ ذَلِكَ حَتَّى وَضَعَ الْحَرْبَةَ عَلَى قَلْبِهِ، ثُمَّ دَعَاهُ فَأَسْلَمَ فَخَلَّى سَبِيلَهُ
english_text: Muhammad b. Fudayl told us, from Al-Walid b. Jumay', he said: A governor of 'Umar b. 'Abd al-'Aziz from Yemen wrote that a man was a Jew, then accepted Islam, then became a Jew again, returning from Islam. 'Umar wrote to him: "Invite him to Islam. If he accepts Islam, let him go. If he refuses, invite him with kindness. Then invite him; if he refuses, restrain him. If he refuses, tie him up, then place the wood against his heart, then invite him. If he returns, let him go. If he refuses, kill him." When the letter came, he did that to him until he placed the spear against his heart, then invited him, and he accepted Islam, so he let him go.
narrators_ar: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ فُضَيْلٍ -> الْوَلِيدِ بْنِ جُمَيْعٍ
narrators_en: Muhammad b. Fudayl -> Al-Walid b. Jumay'

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، أَنَّ عُمَرَ بْنَ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ، قَالَ: يُسْتَتَابُ الْمُرْتَدُّ ثَلَاثًا، فَإِنْ رَجَعَ وَإِلَّا قُتِلَ
english_text: Isma'il b. 'Ayyash told us, from Ibn Jurayj, that 'Umar b. 'Abd al-'Aziz said: "The apostate is asked to repent three times. If he returns [to Islam], [well and good]; otherwise, he is killed."
narrators_ar: إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ، ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، عُمَرَ بْنَ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ
narrators_en: Isma'il b. 'Ayyash, Ibn Jurayj, 'Umar b. 'Abd al-'Aziz

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، عَنْ عَامِرٍ، وَالْحَكَمِ، قَالَا: فِي الرَّجُلِ الْمُسْلِمِ يَرْتَدُّ عَنِ الْإِسْلَامِ وَيَلْحَقُ بِأَرْضِ الْعَدُوِّ فَلْتَعْتَدَّ امْرَأَتُهُ ثَلَاثَةَ قُرُوءٍ إِنْ كَانَتْ تَحِيضُ، وَإِنْ كَانَتْ لَا تَحِيضُ فَثَلَاثَةُ أَشْهُرٍ، وَإِنْ كَانَتْ حَامِلًا أَنْ تَضَعَ حَمْلَهَا، وَيُقَسَّمُ مِيرَاثُهُ بَيْنَ امْرَأَتِهِ وَوَرَثَتِهِ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ، ثُمَّ تُزَوَّجُ إِنْ شَاءَتْ، وَإِنْ هُوَ رَجَعَ فَتَابَ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ تَنْقَضِيَ عِدَّتُهَا ثَبَتَا عَلَى نِكَاحِهِمَا
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman told us, from Ash'ath, from 'Amir and Al-Hakam, who both said: "Regarding a Muslim man who apostatizes from Islam and joins the enemy land: his wife should observe 'Iddah for three menstrual cycles if she menstruates, or three months if she does not menstruate, or until she gives birth if she is pregnant. His inheritance is divided between his wife and his Muslim heirs. Then she may marry if she wishes. If he returns and repents before her 'Iddah expires, they remain in their marriage."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، أَشْعَثَ، عَامِرٍ، الْحَكَمِ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman, Ash'ath, 'Amir, Al-Hakam

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا غُنْدَرٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ، فِي رَجُلٍ أَشْرَكَ وَلَحِقَ بِأَرْضِ الْعَدُوِّ قَالَ: لَا تُزَوَّجُ امْرَأَتُهُ، وَقَالَ حَمَّادٌ: تُزَوَّجُ امْرَأَتُهُ
english_text: Ghundar told us, from Shu'bah, from Al-Hakam, regarding a man who committed polytheism and joined the enemy land. He said: "His wife is not married off." Hammad said: "His wife is married off."
narrators_ar: غُنْدَرٌ، شُعْبَةَ، الْحَكَمِ، حَمَّادٌ
narrators_en: Ghundar, Shu'bah, Al-Hakam, Hammad

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنِ الْأَعْمَشِ، عَنْ أَبِي عَمْرٍو الشَّيْبَانِيِّ، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ، أَنَّهُ أَتَى بِمُسْتَوْرِدٍ الْعِجْلِيِّ وَقَدِ ارْتَدَّ فَعَرَضَ عَلَيْهِ الْإِسْلَامَ فَأَبَى، قَالَ: فَقَتَلَهُ وَجَعَلَ مِيرَاثَهُ بَيْنَ وَرَثَتِهِ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
english_text: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, from Al-A'mash, from Abu 'Amr al-Shaybani, from 'Ali, that Al-Mustawrid al-'Ijli was brought to him having apostatized. He offered him Islam, but he refused. He said: "So he killed him and distributed his inheritance among his Muslim heirs."
narrators_ar: أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، الْأَعْمَشِ، أَبِي عَمْرٍو الشَّيْبَانِيِّ، عَلِيٍّ، بِمُسْتَوْرِدٍ الْعِجْلِيِّ
narrators_en: Abu Mu'awiyah, Al-A'mash, Abu 'Amr al-Shaybani, 'Ali, Al-Mustawrid al-'Ijli

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ، أَنَّ عَلِيًّا قَسَّمَ مِيرَاثَ الْمُرْتَدِّ بَيْنَ وَرَثَتِهِ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
english_text: Yazid b. Harun told us, from Hajjaj, from Al-Hakam, that 'Ali distributed the inheritance of an apostate among his Muslim heirs.
narrators_ar: يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، حَجَّاجٍ، الْحَكَمِ، عَلِيًّا
narrators_en: Yazid b. Harun, Hajjaj, Al-Hakam, 'Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ فُضَيْلٍ، عَنِ الْوَلِيدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جُمَيْعٍ، عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ، قَالَ: إِذَا قُتِلَ الْمُرْتَدُّ وَرِثَهُ وَلَدُهُ
english_text: Muhammad b. Fudayl told us, from Al-Walid b. 'Abd Allah b. Jumay', from Al-Qasim b. 'Abd al-Rahman, from 'Abd Allah, who said: "If an apostate is killed, his child inherits from him."
narrators_ar: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ فُضَيْلٍ، الْوَلِيدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جُمَيْعٍ، الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ، عَبْدِ اللَّهِ
narrators_en: Muhammad b. Fudayl, Al-Walid b. 'Abd Allah b. Jumay', Al-Qasim b. 'Abd al-Rahman, 'Abd Allah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ مَهْدِيٍّ، عَنْ جَرِيرِ بْنِ حَازِمٍ، قَالَ: "كَتَبَ عُمَرُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ فِي مِيرَاثِ الْمُرْتَدِّ لِوَرَثَتِهِ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ وَلَيْسَ لِأَهْلِ دِينِهِ شَيْءٌ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi told us, from Jarir b. Hazim, who said: 'Umar b. 'Abd al-'Aziz wrote regarding the inheritance of an apostate: "It belongs to his Muslim heirs, and people of his [new] religion get nothing."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ مَهْدِيٍّ، جَرِيرِ بْنِ حَازِمٍ، عُمَرُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi, Jarir b. Hazim, 'Umar b. 'Abd al-'Aziz

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ مِسْعَرٍ، وَسُفْيَانَ، عَنْ أَبِي الصَّبَّاحِ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ سَعِيدَ بْنَ الْمُسَيِّبِ، يَقُولُ: الْمُرْتَدُّ نَرِثُهُمْ وَلَا يَرِثُونَا
english_text: Waki' told us, from Mis'ar and Sufyan, from Abu al-Sabbah, who said: I heard Sa'id b. al-Musayyib say: "As for the apostate, we inherit from them, but they do not inherit from us."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، مِسْعَرٍ، سُفْيَانَ، أَبِي الصَّبَّاحِ، سَعِيدَ بْنَ الْمُسَيِّبِ
narrators_en: Waki', Mis'ar, Sufyan, Abu al-Sabbah, Sa'id b. al-Musayyib

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ أَبِي كَثِيرٍ، قَالَ: "سَأَلْتُ سَعِيدَ بْنَ الْمُسَيِّبِ عَنْ مِيرَاثِ الْمُرْتَدِّ، هَلْ يُوَصَّلُ إِذَا قُتِلَ؟ قَالَ: وَمَا يُوَصَّلُ؟ قَالَ: يَرِثُهُ وَرَثَتُهُ قَالَ: نَرِثُهُمْ وَلَا يَرِثُونَا
english_text: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from Musa b. Abi Kathir, who said: I asked Sa'id b. al-Musayyib about the inheritance of an apostate: "Is it given if he is killed?" He said: "What is given?" He said: "His heirs inherit from him." He said: "We inherit from them, but they do not inherit from us."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، مُوسَى بْنِ أَبِي كَثِيرٍ، سَعِيدَ بْنَ الْمُسَيِّبِ
narrators_en: Waki', Sufyan, Musa b. Abi Kathir, Sa'id b. al-Musayyib

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُسْهِرٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، قَالَ: يُقْتَلُ وَمِيرَاثُهُ بَيْنَ وَرَثَتِهِ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
english_text: 'Ali b. Mushir told us, from Ibn Abi 'Arubah, from Qatadah, from Al-Hasan, who said: "He is killed, and his inheritance is distributed among his Muslim heirs."
narrators_ar: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُسْهِرٍ، ابْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ، قَتَادَةَ، الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: 'Ali b. Mushir, Ibn Abi 'Arubah, Qatadah, Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، وَالْحَكَمِ، قَالَا: يُقَسَّمُ مِيرَاثُهُ بَيْنَ امْرَأَتِهِ وَوَرَثَتِهِ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman told us, from Ash'ath, from Al-Sha'bi and Al-Hakam, who both said: "His inheritance is divided between his wife and his Muslim heirs."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، أَشْعَثَ، الشَّعْبِيِّ، الْحَكَمِ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman, Ash'ath, Al-Sha'bi, Al-Hakam

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ مَهْدِيٍّ، عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ سَلَمَةَ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ خِلَاسٍ، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ، فِي الْمُرْتَدَّةِ تُسْتَتَابُ، وَقَالَ حَمَّادٌ: تُقْتَلُ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi told us, from Hammad b. Salamah, from Qatadah, from Khilas, from 'Ali, regarding the female apostate: she is asked to repent. And Hammad said: She is killed.
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ مَهْدِيٍّ، حَمَّادِ بْنِ سَلَمَةَ، قَتَادَةَ، خِلَاسٍ، عَلِيٍّ، حَمَّادٌ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahman b. Mahdi, Hammad b. Salamah, Qatadah, Khilas, 'Ali, Hammad

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، وَوَكِيعٌ، عَنْ أَبِي حَنِيفَةَ، عَنْ عَاصِمٍ، عَنْ أَبِي رَزِينٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، قَالَ: لَا تُقْتَلُ النِّسَاءُ إِذَا ارْتَدَدْنَ عَنِ الْإِسْلَامِ، وَلَكِنْ يُحْبَسْنَ وَيُدْعَيْنَ إِلَى الْإِسْلَامِ وَيُجْبَرْنَ عَلَيْهِ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman and Waki' told us, from Abu Hanifah, from 'Asim, from Abu Razin, from Ibn 'Abbas, who said: "Women are not killed if they apostatize from Islam, but they are imprisoned, invited to Islam, and compelled to accept it."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، وَكِيعٌ، أَبِي حَنِيفَةَ، عَاصِمٍ، أَبِي رَزِينٍ، ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman, Waki', Abu Hanifah, 'Asim, Abu Razin, Ibn 'Abbas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ لَيْثٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، فِي الْمُرْتَدَّةِ قَالَ: لَا تُقْتَلُ
english_text: Hafs told us, from Layth, from 'Ata', regarding the female apostate. He said: "She is not killed."
narrators_ar: حَفْصٌ، لَيْثٍ، عَطَاءٍ
narrators_en: Hafs, Layth, 'Ata'

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ عَمْرٍو، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، قَالَ: لَا تُقْتَلُ
english_text: Hafs told us, from 'Amr, from Al-Hasan, who said: "She is not killed."
narrators_ar: حَفْصٌ، عَمْرٍو، الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Hafs, 'Amr, Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، قَالَ: لَا تُقْتَلُ النِّسَاءُ إِذَا هُنَّ ارْتَدَدْنَ عَنِ الْإِسْلَامِ، وَلَكِنْ يُدْعَيْنَ إِلَى الْإِسْلَامِ، فَإِنْ هُنَّ أَبَيْنَ سُبِينَ وَجُعِلْنَ إِمَاءً لِلْمُسْلِمِينَ وَلَا يُقْتَلْنَ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman told us, from Ash'ath, from Al-Hasan, who said: "Women are not killed if they apostatize from Islam. Rather, they are invited to Islam. If they refuse, they are taken captive and made slaves for the Muslims, but they are not killed."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، أَشْعَثَ، الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman, Ash'ath, Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو دَاوُدَ، عَنْ أَبِي حَرَّةَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ فِي الْمَرْأَةِ تَرْتَدُّ عَنِ الْإِسْلَامِ قَالَ، لَا تُقْتَلُ، تُحْبَسُ
english_text: Abu Dawud told us, from Abu Hurrah, from Al-Hasan, regarding the woman who apostatizes from Islam. He said: "She is not killed; she is imprisoned."
narrators_ar: أَبُو دَاوُدَ، أَبِي حَرَّةَ، الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Abu Dawud, Abu Hurrah, Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ عُبَيْدَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، قَالَ: لَا تُقْتَلُ
english_text: Hafs told us, from 'Ubaydah, from Ibrahim, who said: "She is not killed."
narrators_ar: حَفْصٌ، عُبَيْدَةَ، إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Hafs, 'Ubaydah, Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ، عَنْ هِشَامٍ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، فِي الْمُرْتَدَّةِ: تُسْتَتَابُ، فَإِنْ تَابَتْ وَإِلَّا قُتِلَتْ
english_text: 'Abd Allah b. Idris told us, from Hisham, from Al-Hasan, regarding the female apostate: "She is asked to repent. If she repents, [good]; otherwise she is killed."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ، هِشَامٍ، الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: 'Abd Allah b. Idris, Hisham, Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ، أَنَّ أُمَّ وَلَدِ، رَجُلٍ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ ارْتَدَّتْ، فَبَاعَهَا بِدَوْمَةِ الْجَنْدَلِ مِنْ غَيْرِ أَهْلِ دِينِهَا
english_text: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from Yahya b. Sa'id, from 'Umar b. 'Abd al-'Aziz, that the Umm Walad of a Muslim man apostatized, so he sold her in Dumat al-Jandal to people not of her religion.
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، يَحْيَى بْنِ سَعِيدٍ، عُمَرَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ
narrators_en: Waki', Sufyan, Yahya b. Sa'id, 'Umar b. 'Abd al-'Aziz

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ أَبِي مَعْشَرٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، فِي الْمَرْأَةِ تَرْتَدُّ عَنِ الْإِسْلَامِ، قَالَ: تُسْتَتَابُ، فَإِنْ تَابَتْ وَإِلَّا قُتِلَتْ،
english_text: Waki' told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Abu Ma'shar, from Ibrahim, regarding a woman who apostatizes from Islam. He said: "She is asked to repent. If she repents, [good]; otherwise she is killed."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانُ، أَبِي مَعْشَرٍ، إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Waki', Sufyan, Abu Ma'shar, Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ بِشْرٍ، قَالَ: ثنا سَعِيدٌ، عَنْ أَبِي مَعْشَرٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، بِنَحْوٍ مِنْهُ
english_text: Muhammad b. Bishr told us, he said: Sa'id told us, from Abu Ma'shar, from Ibrahim, something similar.
narrators_ar: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ بِشْرٍ، سَعِيدٌ، أَبِي مَعْشَرٍ، إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Muhammad b. Bishr, Sa'id, Abu Ma'shar, Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ، قَالَ: "كَانَ أَهْلُ الْعِلْمِ يَقُولُونَ: إِذَا آمَنَ الْمُحَارِبُ لَمْ يُؤْخَذْ بِشَيْءٍ كَانَ أَصَابَهُ فِي حَالِ حَرْبِهِ إِلَّا أَنْ يَكُونَ شَيْئًا أَصَابَهُ قَبْلَ ذَلِكَ
english_text: Hafs told us, from Hajjaj, from Al-Hakam, who said: "The people of knowledge used to say: If a belligerent (Muharib) is granted safety, he is not held accountable for anything he committed during his war, unless it is something he committed before that."
narrators_ar: حَفْصٌ، حَجَّاجٍ، الْحَكَمِ
narrators_en: Hafs, Hajjaj, Al-Hakam

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدَةُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ هِشَامٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، فِي الرَّجُلِ يُصِيبُ الْحُدُودَ ثُمَّ يَجِيءُ تَائِبًا، قَالَ: تُقَامُ عَلَيْهِ الْحُدُودُ
english_text: 'Abdah b. Sulayman told us, from Hisham, from his father, regarding a man who commits offenses warranting Hadd punishment and then comes repenting. He said: "The Hadd punishments are established upon him."
narrators_ar: عَبْدَةُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، هِشَامٍ، أَبِيهِ
narrators_en: 'Abdah b. Sulayman, Hisham, his father

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ عُبَيْدَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، فِي الرَّجُلِ يَجْنِي الْجِنَايَةَ فَيَلْحَقُ بِالْعَدُوِّ فَيُصِيبُهُمْ أَمَانٌ، قَالَ: يُؤَمَّنُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يُعْرَفَ شَيْءٌ بِعَيْنِهِ فَيُؤْخَذُ مِنْهُمْ، فَيُرَدُّ عَلَى أَصْحَابِهِ، وَأَمَّا هُوَ فَيُؤْخَذُ بِمَا كَانَ جَنَى قَبْلَ أَنْ يَلْحَقَ بِهِمْ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman told us, from 'Ubaydah, from Ibrahim, regarding a man who commits a crime and joins the enemy, and they receive a pledge of safety. He said: "They are granted safety unless a specific item is recognized, which is taken from them and returned to its owners. As for him, he is held accountable for what he committed before joining them."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عُبَيْدَةَ، إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman, 'Ubaydah, Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا جَرِيرٌ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ حَمَّادٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، فِي رَجُلٍ أَصَابَ حَدًّا ثُمَّ خَرَجَ مُحَارِبًا ثُمَّ طَلَبَ أَمَانًا فَأُمِّنَ، قَالَ: يُقَامُ عَلَيْهِ الْحَدُّ الَّذِي كَانَ أَصَابَهُ
english_text: Jarir told us, from Mughirah, from Hammad, from Ibrahim, regarding a man who committed an offense warranting Hadd punishment, then went out as a belligerent, then sought safety and was granted it. He said: "The Hadd punishment he had incurred is established upon him."
narrators_ar: جَرِيرٌ، مُغِيرَةَ، حَمَّادٍ، إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Jarir, Mughirah, Hammad, Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا جَرِيرٌ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ حَمَّادٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، فِي الرَّجُلِ إِذَا قَطَعَ الطَّرِيقَ وَأَغَارَ، ثُمَّ رَجَعَ تَائِبًا أُقِيمَ عَلَيْهِ الْحَدُّ، وَتَوْبَتُهُ فِيمَا بَيْنَهُ وَبَيْنَ رَبِّهِ
english_text: Jarir told us, from Mughirah, from Hammad, from Ibrahim, regarding a man who commits highway robbery and raids, then returns repenting. He said: "The Hadd punishment is established upon him, and his repentance is between him and his Lord."
narrators_ar: جَرِيرٌ، مُغِيرَةَ، حَمَّادٍ، إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Jarir, Mughirah, Hammad, Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، قَالَ: ثنا جَرِيرُ بْنُ حَازِمٍ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنِي قَيْسُ بْنُ سَعْدٍ، أَنَّ عَطَاءً، كَانَ يَقُولُ: لَوْ أَنَّ رَجُلًا مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ قَتَلَ رَجُلًا ثُمَّ كَفَرَ فَلَحِقَ بِالْمُشْرِكِينَ فَكَانَ فِيهِمْ، ثُمَّ رَجَعَ تَائِبًا قُبِلَتْ تَوْبَتُهُ مِنْ شِرْكِهِ، وَأُقِيمَ عَلَيْهِ الْقِصَاصُ، وَلَوْ أَنَّهُ لَحِقَ بِالْمُشْرِكِينَ وَلَمْ يُقْتَلْ فَكَفَرَ ثُمَّ قَاتَلَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ فَقَتَلَ مِنْهُمْ ثُمَّ جَاءَ تَائِبًا قُبِلَ مِنْهُ وَلَمْ يَكُنْ عَلَيْهِ شَيْءٌ
english_text: Abu Usamah told us, he said: Jarir b. Hazim told us, he said: Qays b. Sa'd told me that 'Ata' used to say: "If a Muslim man killed a man, then disbelieved and joined the polytheists and was among them, then returned repenting, his repentance from polytheism would be accepted, and retaliation (Qisas) would be exacted upon him. If he joined the polytheists and had not killed [before], then disbelieved, then fought the Muslims and killed some of them, then came repenting, it would be accepted from him and there would be nothing upon him."
narrators_ar: أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، جَرِيرُ بْنُ حَازِمٍ، قَيْسُ بْنُ سَعْدٍ، عَطَاءً
narrators_en: Abu Usamah, Jarir b. Hazim, Qays b. Sa'd, 'Ata'

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، عَنْ مُجَالِدٍ، عَنْ عَامِرٍ، قَالَ: كَانَ حَارِثَةُ بْنُ بَدْرٍ التَّمِيمِيُّ مِنْ أَهْلِ الْبَصْرَةِ قَدْ أَفْسَدَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَحَارَبَ، فَكَلَّمَ الْحَسَنَ بْنَ عَلِيٍّ وَابْنَ جَعْفَرٍ وَابْنَ عَبَّاسٍ وَغَيْرَهُمْ مِنْ قُرَيْشٍ، فَكَلَّمُوا عَلِيًّا فَلَمْ يُؤَمِّنْهُ، فَأَتَى سَعِيدَ بْنَ قَيْسٍ الْهَمْدَانِيَّ فَكَلَّمَهُ، فَانْطَلَقَ سَعِيدٌ إِلَى عَلِيٍّ وَخَلَفَهُ فِي مَنْزِلِهِ فَقَالَ: يَا أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ، كَيْفَ تَقُولُ فِيمَنْ حَارَبَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ وَسَعَى فِي الْأَرْضِ فَسَادًا؟ فَقَرَأَ {إِنَّمَا جَزَاءُ الَّذِينَ يُحَارِبُونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ} [المائدة: 33] حَتَّى قَرَأَ الْآيَةَ كُلَّهَا، فَقَالَ سَعِيدٌ، أَفَرَأَيْتُ مَنْ تَابَ قَبْلَ أَنْ نَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ؟ فَقَالَ عَلِيٌّ: أَقُولُ كَمَا قَالَ "وَيُقْبَلُ مِنْهُ، قَالَ: فَإِنَّ حَارِثَةَ بْنَ بَدْرٍ قَدْ تَابَ قَبْلَ أَنْ نَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ، فَبَعَثَ إِلَيْهِ فَأَدْخَلَهُ عَلَيْهِ فَأَمَّنَهُ وَكَتَبَ لَهُ كِتَابًا فَقَالَ حَارِثَةُ: [البحر الطويل] أَلَا أُبَلِّغَنَّ هَمْدَانَ إِمَّا لَقِيتَهَا... سَلَامًا فَلَمْ يَسْلَمْ عَدُوٌّ يَعِيبُهَا لَعَمْرُ أَبِيكَ إِنَّ هَمْدَانَ تَتَّقِي الْإِلَهَ وَيَقْضِي بِالْكِتَابِ خَطِيبُهَا تَشِيبُ رَأْسِي وَاسْتَخَفَّ حُلُومَنَا... رُعُودُ الْمَنَايَا حَوْلَنَا وَبُرُوقُهَا وَإِنَّا لَتَسْتَحْلِي الْمَنَايَا نُفُوسُنَا... وَنَتْرُكُ أُخْرَى مُرَّةً مَا نَذُوقُهَا قَالَ ابْنُ عَامِرٍ: فَحَدَّثْتُ بِهَذَا الْحَدِيثِ عَبْدَ اللَّهِ بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ فَقَالَ: نَحْنُ كُنَّا أَحَقَّ بِهَذِهِ الْأَبْيَاتِ مِنْ هَمْدَانَ
english_text: Abu Usamah told us, from Mujalid, from 'Amir, who said: Harithah b. Badr al-Tamimi from the people of Basra had caused corruption in the land and waged war. He spoke to Al-Hasan b. 'Ali, Ibn Ja'far, Ibn 'Abbas, and others from Quraysh. They spoke to 'Ali, but he did not grant him safety. So he went to Sa'id b. Qays al-Hamdani and spoke to him. Sa'id went to 'Ali and left him [Harithah] in his house. He said: "O Commander of the Faithful, what do you say about someone who wages war against Allah and His Messenger and strives to cause corruption on earth?" He recited: {Indeed, the penalty for those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger} [Al-Ma'idah: 33] until he finished the verse. Sa'id said: "What do you think about one who repents before we overpower him?" 'Ali said: "I say as He said: it is accepted from him." He said: "Indeed, Harithah b. Badr has repented before we overpowered him." So he sent for him, brought him in, granted him safety, and wrote a document for him. Harithah said: "Indeed, convey to Hamdan if I meet them... Peace, for an enemy who criticizes them is not safe... By your father's life, Hamdan fears God... And their preacher judges by the Book... My head turns gray and our dreams were belittled... The thunder of death around us and its lightning... And indeed, our souls find death sweet... And we leave another bitter [life] that we do not taste." Ibn 'Amir said: I narrated this hadith to 'Abd Allah b. Ja'far, and he said: "We were more deserving of these verses than Hamdan."
narrators_ar: أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، مُجَالِدٍ، عَامِرٍ، حَارِثَةَ بْنَ بَدْرٍ التَّمِيمِيَّ، الْحَسَنَ بْنَ عَلِيٍّ، ابْنَ جَعْفَرٍ، ابْنَ عَبَّاسٍ، عَلِيًّا، سَعِيدَ بْنَ قَيْسٍ الْهَمْدَانِيَّ، ابْنُ عَامِرٍ، عَبْدَ اللَّهِ بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ
narrators_en: Abu Usamah, Mujalid, 'Amir, Harithah b. Badr al-Tamimi, Al-Hasan b. 'Ali, Ibn Ja'far, Ibn 'Abbas, 'Ali, Sa'id b. Qays al-Hamdani, Ibn 'Amir, 'Abd Allah b. Ja'far

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، زَعَمَ أَنَّ رَجُلًا، مِنْ مُرَادٍ حَلَّ، فَلَمَّا سَلَّمَ أَبُو مُوسَى قَامَ فَقَالَ: هَذَا مَقَامُ التَّائِبِ الْعَائِذِ فَقَالَ: وَيْلَكَ مَا لَكَ؟ قَالَ: أَنَا فُلَانُ بْنُ فُلَانٍ الْمُرَادِيُّ، وَإِنِّي كُنْتُ حَارَبْتُ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ وَسَعَيْتُ فِي الْأَرْضِ فَسَادًا، فَهَذَا حِينَ جِئْتُ وَقَدْ تُبْتُ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ تَقْدِرَ عَلَيَّ، قَالَ: فَقَامَ أَبُو مُوسَى الْمَقَامَ الَّذِي قَامَ فِيهِ ثُمَّ قَالَ: "إِنَّ هَذَا فُلَانُ بْنُ فُلَانٍ الْمُرَادِيُّ: وَإِنَّهُ كَانَ حَارَبَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ وَسَعَى فِي الْأَرْضِ فَسَادًا، وَإِنَّهُ قَدْ تَابَ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ نَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ، فَإِنْ يَكُ صَادِقًا فَسَبِيلُ مَنْ صَدَقَ، وَإِنْ كَانَ كَاذِبًا يَأْخُذُهُ اللَّهُ بِذَنْبِهِ"، قَالَ فَخَرَجَ فِي النَّاسِ فَذَهَبَ وَلَحَى ثُمَّ عَادَ فَقُتِلَ
english_text: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman told us, from Ash'ath, from Al-Sha'bi, who claimed that a man from Murad settled. When Abu Musa finished prayer, he stood up and said: "This is the place of the repentant refugee." He said: "Woe to you, what is the matter with you?" He said: "I am So-and-so son of So-and-so al-Muradi. Indeed, I waged war against Allah and His Messenger and strove to cause corruption on earth. This is the time I have come, having repented before you overpowered me." He said: Abu Musa stood in the place where he stood and said: "Indeed, this is So-and-so son of So-and-so al-Muradi. He waged war against Allah and His Messenger and strove to cause corruption on earth. He has repented before we overpowered him. If he is truthful, then it is the way of one who speaks the truth. And if he is lying, Allah will seize him for his sin." He said: So he went out among the people, went and argued, then returned and was killed.
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، أَشْعَثَ، الشَّعْبِيِّ، أَبُو مُوسَى
narrators_en: 'Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman, Ash'ath, Al-Sha'bi, Abu Musa

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنْ عَطِيَّةَ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، فِي قَوْلِهِ: "{إِنَّمَا جَزَاءُ الَّذِينَ يُحَارِبُونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ وَيَسْعَوْنَ فِي الْأَرْضِ فَسَادًا أَنْ يُقَتَّلُوا أَوْ يُصَلَّبُوا أَوْ تُقَطَّعَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَأَرْجُلُهُمْ مِنْ خِلَافٍ} [المائدة: 33]" حَتَّى خَتَمَ الْآيَةَ، فَقَالَ: "إِذَا حَارَبَ الرَّجُلُ وَقَتَلَ وَأَخَذَ الْمَالَ، قُطِعَتْ يَدُهُ وَرِجْلُهُ مِنْ خِلَافٍ وَصُلِبَ، وَإِذَا قَتَلَ وَلَمْ يَأْخُذِ الْمَالَ قُتِلَ، وَإِذَا أَخَذَ الْمَالَ وَلَمْ يَقْتُلْ قُطِعَتْ يَدُهُ وَرِجْلُهُ مِنْ خِلَافٍ، وَإِذَا لَمْ يَقْتُلْ وَلَمْ يَأْخُذِ الْمَالَ نُفِيَ
english_text: Ibn Abbas said regarding the verse: "The recompense of those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger and strive upon earth to spread corruption is that they be killed or crucified or have their hands and feet cut off on opposite sides…" [Al-Ma'idah: 33]. He continued until the end of the verse, then said: "If a man wages war, kills someone, and takes property, his hand and foot on opposite sides are cut and he is crucified. If he kills but does not take property, he is executed. If he takes property without killing, his hand and foot on opposite sides are cut. And if he neither kills nor takes property, he is banished."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الرَّحِيمِ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ -> حَجَّاجٌ -> عَطِيَّةُ -> ابْنُ عَبَّاسٍ
narrators_en: Abd al-Rahim b. Sulayman -> Hajjaj -> Atiyyah -> Ibn Abbas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ عِمْرَانَ بْنِ حُدَيْرٍ، عَنْ أَبِي مِجْلَزٍ، فِي هَذِهِ الْآيَةِ {إِنَّمَا جَزَاءُ الَّذِينَ يُحَارِبُونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ} [المائدة: 33] قَالَ: إِذَا قَتَلَ وَأَخَذَ الْمَالَ قُتِلَ، وَإِذَا أَخَذَ الْمَالَ وَأَخَافَ السَّبِيلَ صُلِبَ، وَإِذَا قَتَلَ وَلَمْ يُعِدْ ذَلِكَ قُتِلَ، وَإِذَا أَخَذَ الْمَالَ لَمْ يُعِدْ ذَلِكَ قُطِعَ وَإِذَا أَفْسَدَ نُفِيَ
english_text: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from ‘Imrān ibn Ḥudayr, from Abū Mijlaz, regarding this verse {Indeed, the penalty for those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger} [Al-Mā’idah: 33], he said: "If he killed and took the wealth, he is killed. If he took the wealth and terrified the road, he is crucified. If he killed and did not go beyond that, he is killed. If he took the wealth and did not go beyond that, he is cut [his hand/foot]. And if he caused corruption, he is exiled."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ عِمْرَانَ بْنِ حُدَيْرٍ، عَنْ أَبِي مِجْلَزٍ
narrators_en: Wakī‘ > ‘Imrān ibn Ḥudayr > Abū Mijlaz

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ حَمَّادٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، {إِنَّمَا جَزَاءُ الَّذِينَ يُحَارِبُونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ} [المائدة: 33] قَالَ: إِذَا خَرَجَ وَأَخَافَ السَّبِيلَ وَأَخَذَ الْمَالَ قُطِعَتْ يَدُهُ وَرِجْلُهُ مِنْ خِلَافٍ، وَإِذَا أَخَافَ السَّبِيلَ وَلَمْ يَأْخُذِ الْمَالَ نُفِيَ، وَإِذَا قَتَلَ قُتِلَ، وَإِذَا أَخَافَ السَّبِيلَ وَأَخَذَ الْمَالَ وَقَتَلَ صُلِبَ
english_text: ‘Abdullāh ibn Idrīs narrated to us, from his father, from Ḥammād, from Ibrāhīm, [regarding] {Indeed, the penalty for those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger} [Al-Mā’idah: 33], he said: "If he went out and terrified the road and took the wealth, his hand and his foot are cut off from opposite sides. If he terrified the road and did not take the wealth, he is exiled. If he killed, he is killed. And if he terrified the road and took the wealth and killed, he is crucified."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ حَمَّادٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: ‘Abdullāh ibn Idrīs > Idrīs > Ḥammād > Ibrāhīm

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ بَكْرٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، قَالَ: حُدِّثْتُ عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ جُبَيْرٍ، قَالَ: مَنْ حَارَبَ فَهُوَ مُحَارِبٌ، قَالَ سَعِيدٌ: فَإِنْ أَصَابَ دَمًا قُتِلَ، وَإِنْ أَصَابَ دَمًا وَمَالًا صُلِبَ، فَإِنَّ الصَّلْبَ هُوَ أَشَدُّ، وَإِذَا أَصَابَ مَالًا وَلَمْ يُصِبْ دَمًا قُطِعَتْ يَدُهُ وَرِجْلُهُ لِقَوْلِهِ أَوْ تُقَطَّعَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَأَرْجُلُهُمْ مِنْ خِلَافٍ فَإِنْ مَاتَ فَتَوْبَتُهُ فِيمَا بَيْنَهُ وَبَيْنَ اللَّهِ، وَيُقَامُ عَلَيْهِ الْحَدُّ
english_text: Muḥammad ibn Bakr narrated to us, from Ibn Jurayj, who said: I was told from Sa‘īd ibn Jubayr that he said: "Whoever wages war is a warrior (Muḥārib)." Sa‘īd said: "If he sheds blood, he is killed. If he sheds blood and [takes] wealth, he is crucified, for crucifixion is more severe. And if he takes wealth and does not shed blood, his hand and his foot are cut off, due to His saying: {or that their hands and feet be cut off from opposite sides}. If he dies, his repentance is between him and Allah, and the legal punishment is carried out upon him."
narrators_ar: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ بَكْرٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ جُبَيْرٍ
narrators_en: Muḥammad ibn Bakr > Ibn Jurayj > Sa‘īd ibn Jubayr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا زَيْدُ بْنُ حُبَابٍ، عَنْ أَبِي هِلَالٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ مُوَرِّقٍ الْعِجْلِيِّ، قَالَ: إِذَا أَخَذَ الْمُحَارِبُ فَرُفِعَ إِلَى الْإِمَامِ، فَإِنْ كَانَ أَخَذَ الْمَالَ وَلَمْ يَقْتُلْ قُطِعَ وَلَمْ يُقْتَلْ، وَإِنْ أَخَذَ الْمَالَ وَقَتَلَ قُطِعَ وَصُلِبَ، وَإِنْ كَانَ لَمْ يَأْخُذِ الْمَالَ وَلَمْ يَقْتُلْ لَمْ يُقْطَعْ، وَإِنْ كَانَ لَمْ يَأْخُذِ الْمَالَ وَلَمْ يَقْتُلْ وَشَاقَّ الْمُسْلِمِينَ نُفِيَ
english_text: Zayd ibn Ḥubāb narrated to us, from Abū Hilāl, from Qatādah, from Muwarriq al-‘Ijlī, who said: "If the Muḥārib (one waging war) is seized and brought to the Imām: if he took the wealth and did not kill, he is cut [hand/foot] and not killed. If he took the wealth and killed, he is cut and crucified. If he did not take the wealth and did not kill, he is not cut. And if he did not take the wealth and did not kill, but opposed the Muslims, he is exiled."
narrators_ar: زَيْدُ بْنُ حُبَابٍ، عَنْ أَبِي هِلَالٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ مُوَرِّقٍ الْعِجْلِيِّ
narrators_en: Zayd ibn Ḥubāb > Abū Hilāl > Qatādah > Muwarriq al-‘Ijlī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا الضَّحَّاكُ بْنُ مَخْلَدٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، قَالَ: الْمُحَارَبَةُ الشِّرْكُ
english_text: Aḍ-Ḍaḥḥāk ibn Makhlad narrated to us, from Ibn Jurayj, from ‘Aṭā’, who said: "Al-Muḥārabah (waging war) is Shirk."
narrators_ar: الضَّحَّاكُ بْنُ مَخْلَدٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ
narrators_en: Aḍ-Ḍaḥḥāk ibn Makhlad > Ibn Jurayj > ‘Aṭā’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمُ بْنُ بَشِيرٍ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، وَالْقَاسِمِ بْنِ أَبِي بَزَّةَ، عَنْ مُجَاهِدٍ، وَعَنْ لَيْثٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، عَنْ مُجَاهِدٍ، وَعَنْ أَبِي مُرَّةَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، وَجُوَيْبِرٍ، عَنِ الضَّحَّاكِ، قَالُوا: الْإِمَامُ مُخَيَّرٌ فِي الْمُحَارِبِ
english_text: Hushaym ibn Bashīr narrated to us, from Ḥajjāj, from ‘Aṭā’; and [from] Al-Qāsim ibn Abī Bazzah, from Mujāhid; and from Layth, from ‘Aṭā’, from Mujāhid; and from Abū Murrah, from Al-Ḥasan; and [from] Juwaybir, from Aḍ-Ḍaḥḥāk; they said: "The Imām has the choice regarding the Muḥārib (the one waging war)."
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمُ بْنُ بَشِيرٍ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ | وَالْقَاسِمِ بْنِ أَبِي بَزَّةَ، عَنْ مُجَاهِدٍ | وَعَنْ لَيْثٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، عَنْ مُجَاهِدٍ | وَعَنْ أَبِي مُرَّةَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ | وَجُوَيْبِرٍ، عَنِ الضَّحَّاكِ
narrators_en: Hushaym ibn Bashīr > Ḥajjāj > ‘Aṭā’ | Al-Qāsim ibn Abī Bazzah > Mujāhid | Layth > ‘Aṭā’ > Mujāhid | Abū Murrah > Al-Ḥasan | Juwaybir > Aḍ-Ḍaḥḥāk

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ عَاصِمٍ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، قَالَ: تَلَا هَذِهِ الْآيَةَ " {إِنَّمَا جَزَاءُ الَّذِينَ يُحَارِبُونَ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ} [المائدة: 33] " قَالَ: ذَلِكَ إِلَى الْإِمَامِ
english_text: Ḥafṣ narrated to us, from ‘Āṣim, from Al-Ḥasan, who said: He recited this verse: "{Indeed, the penalty for those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger...}" [Al-Mā'idah: 33]. He said: "That is up to the Imām."
narrators_ar: حَفْصٌ، عَنْ عَاصِمٍ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Ḥafṣ > ‘Āṣim > Al-Ḥasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو، عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ، قَالَ: السُّلْطَانُ وَلِيٌّ قَتْلِ مَنْ حَارَبَ الدِّينَ وَإِنْ قَتَلَ أَخَا امْرِئٍ وَأَبَاهُ، فَلَيْسَ إِلَى مَنْ يُحَارِبُ الدِّينَ وَيَسْعَى فِي الْأَرْضِ فَسَادًا سَبِيلٌ، يَعْنِي دُونَ السُّلْطَانِ، وَلَا يُقَصَّرْ عَنِ الْحُدُودِ بَعْدَ أَنْ تَبْلُغَ إِلَى الْإِمَامِ، فَإِنَّ إِقَامَتَهَا مِنَ السُّنَّةِ
english_text: Abū Usāmah narrated to us, from Muḥammad ibn ‘Amr, from ‘Umar ibn ‘Abd al-‘Azīz, who said: "The Sulṭān is the guardian of killing whoever wages war against the religion, even if he killed a man's brother or father. There is no way [for anyone else] against those who wage war against the religion and strive upon earth [to cause] corruption—meaning other than the Sulṭān. And one should not fall short regarding the Ḥudūd (legal punishments) after they reach the Imām, for establishing them is from the Sunnah."
narrators_ar: أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو، عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ
narrators_en: Abū Usāmah > Muḥammad ibn ‘Amr > ‘Umar ibn ‘Abd al-‘Azīz

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا زَيْدُ بْنُ الْحُبَابِ، عَنْ أَبِي هِلَالٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ، فِي الْمُحَارِبِ: إِذَا رُفِعَ إِلَى الْإِمَامِ يَصْنَعُ بِهِ مَا شَاءَ
english_text: Zayd ibn al-Ḥubāb narrated to us, from Abū Hilāl, from Qatādah, from Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib, regarding the Muḥārib (one who wages war): "If he is raised to the Imām, he does with him whatever he wills."
narrators_ar: زَيْدُ بْنُ الْحُبَابِ، عَنْ أَبِي هِلَالٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ
narrators_en: Zayd ibn al-Ḥubāb > Abū Hilāl > Qatādah > Sa‘īd ibn al-Musayyib

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا سَعِيدُ بْنُ عَامِرٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ أَبِي حَرَّةَ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، قَالَ: لَأَنْ يَذْهَبَ وَيَرْجِعَ أَحَبُّ إِلَيْهِ، وَسَأَلَهُ ابْنٌ أَوْ أَخٌ لَهُ يَغْزُو
english_text: Sa‘īd ibn ‘Āmir narrated to us, from Sa‘īd ibn Abī ‘Arūbah, from Sa‘īd ibn Abī Ḥarrah, from Nāfi‘, from Ibn ‘Umar, who said: "That he goes and returns is more beloved to him." A son or brother of his had asked him about raiding.
narrators_ar: سَعِيدُ بْنُ عَامِرٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ أَبِي حَرَّةَ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Sa‘īd ibn ‘Āmir > Sa‘īd ibn Abī ‘Arūbah > Sa‘īd ibn Abī Ḥarrah > Nāfi‘ > Ibn ‘Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا جَرِيرٌ، عَنْ لَيْثٍ، عَنْ مُجَاهِدٍ، قَالَ: لَا يُدْفَنُ مَعَ الْقَتِيلِ خُفٌّ وَلَا نَعْلٌ
english_text: Jarīr narrated to us, from Layth, from Mujāhid, who said: "Neither a leather sock (Khuff) nor a sandal is to be buried with the slain."
narrators_ar: جَرِيرٌ، عَنْ لَيْثٍ، عَنْ مُجَاهِدٍ
narrators_en: Jarīr > Layth > Mujāhid

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، قَالَ: يُنْزَعُ عَنِ الْقَتِيلِ الْفَرْوُ وَالْجَوْرَبَانِ، وَالْمَوْزَجَانُ، وَالْأَفْرَاهَيْجَانُ، إِلَّا أَنْ يَكُونَ الْجَوْرَبَانِ يُكَمِّلَانِ فَيُتْرَكَانِ عَلَيْهِ
english_text: Abū al-Aḥwaṣ narrated to us, from Mughīrah, from Ibrāhīm, who said: "The fur coat, the socks (Jawrabān), the boots (Mawzajān), and the leggings (Afrāhayjān) are removed from the slain, unless the socks complete [his covering], in which case they are left on him."
narrators_ar: أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Abū al-Aḥwaṣ > Mughīrah > Ibrāhīm

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ مُخَوَّلٍ، عَنِ الْعَيْزَارِ بْنِ حُرَيْثٍ، قَالَ: قَالَ زَيْدُ بْنُ صُوحَانَ: لَا تَنْزِعُوا عَنِّي ثَوْبًا إِلَّا الْخُفَّيْنِ
english_text: Wakī‘ narrated to us, from Sufyān, from Mukhawwal, from Al-‘Ayzār ibn Ḥurayth, who said: Zayd ibn Ṣūḥān said: "Do not remove any garment from me except the Khuffayn (leather socks)."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ مُخَوَّلٍ، عَنِ الْعَيْزَارِ بْنِ حُرَيْثٍ
narrators_en: Wakī‘ > Sufyān > Mukhawwal > Al-‘Ayzār ibn Ḥurayth

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عِيسَى بْنُ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْأَوْزَاعِيِّ، عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ حَسَّانَ، قَالَ: "كَانَ مُحَمَّدٌ إِذَا سُئِلَ عَنِ الشَّهِيدِ يُغَسَّلُ؟ حَدَّثَ عَنْ حُجْرِ بْنِ عَدِيٍّ، إِذْ قَتَلَهُ مُعَاوِيَةُ قَالَ: قَالَ حُجْرٌ: لَا تَطْلِقُوا عَنِّي حَدِيدًا وَتَغْسِلُوا عَنِّي دَمًا، ادْفِنُونِي فِي وِثَاقِي وَدَمِي، أَلْقَى مُعَاوِيَةَ عَنِ الْجَادَّةِ غَدًا
english_text: ‘Īsā ibn Yūnus narrated to us, from Al-Awzā‘ī, from Hishām ibn Ḥassān, who said: Whenever Muḥammad [Ibn Sīrīn] was asked about the martyr—is he to be washed?—he would narrate regarding Ḥujr ibn ‘Adī, when Mu‘āwiyah killed him. He said: Ḥujr said: "Do not undo any iron [chains] from me, nor wash any blood from me. Bury me in my bonds and my blood; I will meet Mu‘āwiyah on the main road [of the Hereafter] tomorrow."
narrators_ar: عِيسَى بْنُ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْأَوْزَاعِيِّ، عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ حَسَّانَ
narrators_en: ‘Īsā ibn Yūnus > Al-Awzā‘ī > Hishām ibn Ḥassān

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عِيسَى بْنُ يُونُسَ، عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ أَبِي خَالِدٍ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ يَحْيَى بْنَ عَابِسٍ، يُخْبِرُ قَيْسَ بْنَ أَبِي حَازِمٍ عَنْ عَمَّارِ بْنِ يَاسِرٍ، أَنَّهُ قَالَ: ادْفِنُونِي فِي ثِيَابِي فَإِنِّي مُخَاصِمٌ
english_text: ‘Īsā ibn Yūnus narrated to us, from Ismā‘īl ibn Abī Khālid, who said: I heard Yaḥyā ibn ‘Ābis informing Qays ibn Abī Ḥāzim, from ‘Ammār ibn Yāsir, that he said: "Bury me in my clothes, for indeed I am a disputant."
narrators_ar: عِيسَى بْنُ يُونُسَ، عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ أَبِي خَالِدٍ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ عَابِسٍ، عَنْ قَيْسَ بْنَ أَبِي حَازِمٍ، عَنْ عَمَّارِ بْنِ يَاسِرٍ
narrators_en: ‘Īsā ibn Yūnus > Ismā‘īl ibn Abī Khālid > Yaḥyā ibn ‘Ābis > Qays ibn Abī Ḥāzim > ‘Ammār ibn Yāsir

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ أَبِي خَالِدٍ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ عَابِسٍ، عَنْ عَمَّارِ بْنِ يَاسِرٍ، نَحْوَهُ
english_text: Wakī‘ narrated to us, saying: Ismā‘īl ibn Abī Khālid narrated to us, from Yaḥyā ibn ‘Ābis, from ‘Ammār ibn Yāsir, similar to it.
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ أَبِي خَالِدٍ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ عَابِسٍ، عَنْ عَمَّارِ بْنِ يَاسِرٍ
narrators_en: Wakī‘ > Ismā‘īl ibn Abī Khālid > Yaḥyā ibn ‘Ābis > ‘Ammār ibn Yāsir

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ مُخَوَّلِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ النَّهْدِيِّ، عَنِ الْعَيْزَارِ بْنِ حُرَيْثٍ الْعَبْدِيِّ، قَالَ: قَالَ زَيْدُ بْنُ صُوحَانَ يَوْمَ الْجَمَلِ: أَرْمِسُونِي فِي الْأَرْضِ رَمْسًا، وَلَا تَغْسِلُوا عَنِّي دَمًا، وَلَا تَنْزِعُوا عَنِّي ثَوْبًا إِلَّا الْخُفَّيْنِ، فَإِنِّي مُحَاجٌّ أُحَاجُّ
english_text: Wakī‘ narrated to us, saying: Sufyān narrated to us, from Mukhawwal ibn Rāshid an-Nahdī, from Al-‘Ayzār ibn Ḥurayth al-‘Abdī, who said: Zayd ibn Ṣūḥān said on the Day of the Camel: "Bury me in the earth, do not wash any blood from me, and do not remove any garment from me except the Khuffayn (leather socks); for indeed I am a disputant, presenting a case."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ مُخَوَّلِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ النَّهْدِيِّ، عَنِ الْعَيْزَارِ بْنِ حُرَيْثٍ الْعَبْدِيِّ
narrators_en: Wakī‘ > Sufyān > Mukhawwal ibn Rāshid an-Nahdī > Al-‘Ayzār ibn Ḥurayth al-‘Abdī

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا مِسْعَرٌ، وَسُفْيَانُ، عَنْ مُصْعَبِ بْنِ الْمُثَنَّى الْعَبْدِيِّ، قَالَ: سُفْيَانُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ، عَنْ زَيْدِ بْنِ صُوحَانَ، وَقَالَ مِسْعَرٌ: عَنْ مُصْعَبٍ، عَنْ زَيْدِ بْنِ صُوحَانَ، أَنَّهُ قَالَ يَوْمَ الْجَمَلِ: ادْفِنُونِي وَمَا أَصَابَ الثَّرَى مِنْ دِمَائِنَا
english_text: Waki' narrated to us, he said: Mis'ar and Sufyan narrated to us, from Mus'ab bin Al-Muthanna Al-Abdi. Sufyan said: From a man, from Zaid bin Suhan. And Mis'ar said: From Mus'ab, from Zaid bin Suhan, that he said on the Day of the Camel: "Bury me with what blood has touched the earth from our blood."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> مِسْعَرٌ / سُفْيَانُ -> مُصْعَبِ بْنِ الْمُثَنَّى الْعَبْدِيِّ -> رَجُلٍ -> زَيْدِ بْنِ صُوحَانَ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Mis'ar / Sufyan -> Mus'ab bin Al-Muthanna Al-Abdi -> A man -> Zaid bin Suhan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ قَيْسِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى، قَالَ: سَعْدُ بْنُ عُبَيْدٍ الْقَارِئُ يَوْمَ الْقَادِسِيَّةِ: إِنَّا لَاقُوا الْعَدُوِّ غَدًا إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ وَإِنَّا مُسْتَشْهِدُونَ، فَلَا تَغْسِلُوا عَنَّا دَمًا وَلَا نُكَفَّنُ إِلَّا فِي ثَوْبٍ كَانَ عَلَيْنَا
english_text: Waki' narrated to us, he said: Sufyan narrated to us, from Qais bin Muslim, from Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Laila, who said: Sa'd bin Ubaid Al-Qari said on the Day of Al-Qadisiyyah: "We are meeting the enemy tomorrow, if Allah wills, and we will be martyred. So do not wash any blood from us, and do not shroud us except in the garment we were wearing."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> سُفْيَانُ -> قَيْسِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ -> عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى -> سَعْدُ بْنُ عُبَيْدٍ الْقَارِئُ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Sufyan -> Qais bin Muslim -> Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Laila -> Sa'd bin Ubaid Al-Qari

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، قَالَ ثنا ثَابِتُ بْنُ عُمَارَةَ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ غُنَيْمَ بْنَ قَيْسٍ، يَقُولُ: الشَّهِيدُ يُدْفَنُ فِي ثِيَابِهِ وَلَا يُغَسَّلُ
english_text: Abu Usamah narrated to us, he said: Thabit bin Umarah narrated to us, he said: I heard Ghunaym bin Qais saying: "The martyr is buried in his clothes and is not washed."
narrators_ar: أَبُو أُسَامَةَ -> ثَابِتُ بْنُ عُمَارَةَ -> غُنَيْمَ بْنَ قَيْسٍ
narrators_en: Abu Usamah -> Thabit bin Umarah -> Ghunaym bin Qais

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَرِيكٌ، عَنْ أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، أَنَّ رَجُلًا مِنْ أَصْحَابِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ قَتَلَهُ الْعَدُوُّ فَدَفَنَّاهُ فِي ثِيَابِهِ
english_text: Sharik narrated to us, from Abu Ishaq, that a man from the companions of Abdullah was killed by the enemy, so we buried him in his clothes.
narrators_ar: شَرِيكٌ -> أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ -> رَجُلًا مِنْ أَصْحَابِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ
narrators_en: Sharik -> Abu Ishaq -> A man from the companions of Abdullah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرِ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، قَالَ: إِذَا رُفِعَ الْقَتِيلُ دُفِنَ فِي ثِيَابِهِ، وَإِذَا رُفِعَ وَبِهِ رَمَقٌ صُنِعَ بِهِ مَا يُصْنَعُ بِغَيْرِهِ
english_text: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash narrated to us, from Mughirah, from Ibrahim, who said: "If the killed person is lifted (dead), he is buried in his clothes. And if he is lifted while he still has a breath of life, he is treated as others are treated."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرِ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ -> مُغِيرَةَ -> إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash -> Mughirah -> Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ عِيسَى بْنِ أَبِي عَزَّةَ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، فِي رَجُلٍ قَتَلَتْهُ اللُّصُوصُ قَالَ: يُدْفَنُ فِي ثِيَابِهِ وَلَا يُغَسَّلُ
english_text: Waki' narrated to us, he said: Sufyan narrated to us, from Isa bin Abi Azzah, from Al-Sha'bi, regarding a man killed by thieves. He said: "He is buried in his clothes and is not washed."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> سُفْيَانُ -> عِيسَى بْنِ أَبِي عَزَّةَ -> الشَّعْبِيِّ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Sufyan -> Isa bin Abi Azzah -> Al-Sha'bi

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَبَابَةُ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنِي لَيْثُ بْنُ سَعْدٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ شِهَابٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ كَعْبِ بْنِ مَالِكٍ، أَنَّ جَابِرَ بْنَ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ، أَخْبَرَهُ أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، لَمْ يُصَلِّ عَلَى قَتْلَى أُحُدٍ وَلَمْ يُغَسَّلُوا
english_text: Shababah narrated to us, he said: Laith bin Sa'd informed me, from Ibn Shihab, from Abd al-Rahman bin Ka'b bin Malik, that Jabir bin Abdullah informed him "that the Prophet (peace be upon him) did not pray over the martyrs of Uhud nor were they washed."
narrators_ar: شَبَابَةُ -> لَيْثُ بْنُ سَعْدٍ -> ابْنِ شِهَابٍ -> عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ كَعْبِ بْنِ مَالِكٍ -> جَابِرَ بْنَ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ -> النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ
narrators_en: Shababah -> Laith bin Sa'd -> Ibn Shihab -> Abd al-Rahman bin Ka'b bin Malik -> Jabir bin Abdullah -> The Prophet (pbuh)

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا سُفْيَانُ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي مَعْشَرٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، قَالَ: الشَّهِيدُ إِذَا كَانَ فِي الْمَعْرَكَةِ دُفِنَ فِي ثِيَابِهِ وَلَمْ يُغَسَّلْ
english_text: Waki' narrated to us, he said: Sufyan narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Arubah, from Abu Ma'shar, from Ibrahim, who said: "The martyr, if he is on the battlefield, is buried in his clothes and is not washed."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> سُفْيَانُ -> ابْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ -> أَبِي مَعْشَرٍ -> إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Sufyan -> Ibn Abi Arubah -> Abu Ma'shar -> Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عِيسَى بْنُ يُونُسَ، عَنْ عَمْرٍو، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، أَمَرَ بِحَمْزَةَ حِينَ اسْتُشْهِدَ فَغُسِّلَ
english_text: Isa bin Yunus narrated to us, from Amr, from Al-Hasan, "that the Prophet (peace be upon him) ordered regarding Hamzah when he was martyred, so he was washed."
narrators_ar: عِيسَى بْنُ يُونُسَ -> عَمْرٍو -> الْحَسَنِ -> النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ
narrators_en: Isa bin Yunus -> Amr -> Al-Hasan -> The Prophet (pbuh)

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا زَكَرِيَّا، عَنْ عَامِرٍ، "أَنَّ حَنْظَلَةَ بْنَ الرَّاهِبِ، طَهَّرَتْهُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ
english_text: Waki' narrated to us, he said: Zakariyya narrated to us, from 'Amir, "that Hanzalah bin Al-Rahib was purified by the angels."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> زَكَرِيَّا -> عَامِرٍ -> حَنْظَلَةَ بْنَ الرَّاهِبِ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Zakariyya -> 'Amir -> Hanzalah bin Al-Rahib

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، فِي الْغُسْلِ إِذَا كَانَ عَلَيْهِ مُهْلٌ غُسِّلَ
english_text: Abd al-A'la narrated to us, from Yunus, from Al-Hasan, regarding washing (a martyr): "If there is dirt/filth upon him, he is washed."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى -> يُونُسَ -> الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Abd al-A'la -> Yunus -> Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا شُعْبَةُ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ، وَالْحَسَنِ، قَالَا: الشَّهِيدُ يُغَسَّلُ، مَا مَاتَ مَيِّتٌ إِلَّا جُنُبٌ
english_text: Waki' narrated to us, he said: Shu'bah narrated to us, from Qatadah, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib and Al-Hasan, who said: "The martyr is washed; no dead person dies except in a state of major ritual impurity (Janabah)."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> شُعْبَةُ -> قَتَادَةَ -> سَعِيدِ بْنِ الْمُسَيِّبِ / الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Shu'bah -> Qatadah -> Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib / Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ نُمَيْرٍ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، قَالَ: غُسِّلَ عُمَرُ وَكُفِّنَ وَحُنِّطَ
english_text: Abdullah bin Numair narrated to us, from Ubaidullah, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, who said: "Umar was washed, shrouded, and embalmed."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ نُمَيْرٍ -> عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ -> نَافِعٍ -> ابْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Abdullah bin Numair -> Ubaidullah -> Nafi' -> Ibn Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ، عَنْ أَبِي مَالِكٍ، قَالَ: صَلَّى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ عَلَى حَمْزَةَ
english_text: Abdullah bin Idris narrated to us, from Abu Malik, who said: "The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) prayed over Hamzah."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ -> أَبِي مَالِكٍ -> رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ
narrators_en: Abdullah bin Idris -> Abu Malik -> The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ فُضَيْلٍ، عَنْ يَزِيدَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْحَارِثِ، قَالَ: صَلَّى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، عَلَى حَمْزَةَ وَكَبَّرَ عَلَيْهِ تِسْعًا
english_text: Ibn Fudayl narrated to us, from Yazid, from Abdullah bin Al-Harith, who said: "The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) prayed over Hamzah and said Takbir over him nine times."
narrators_ar: ابْنُ فُضَيْلٍ -> يَزِيدَ -> عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْحَارِثِ -> رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ
narrators_en: Ibn Fudayl -> Yazid -> Abdullah bin Al-Harith -> The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا سُفْيَانُ، عَنِ الزُّبَيْرِ بْنِ عَدِيٍّ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، صَلَّى عَلَى قَتْلَى بَدْرٍ
english_text: Waki' narrated to us, he said: Sufyan narrated to us, from Al-Zubayr bin Adi, from Ata, "that the Prophet (peace be upon him) prayed over the martyrs of Badr."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> سُفْيَانُ -> الزُّبَيْرِ بْنِ عَدِيٍّ -> عَطَاءٍ -> النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Sufyan -> Al-Zubayr bin Adi -> Ata -> The Prophet (pbuh)

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: ثنا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ جَابِرٍ، قَالَ: "سُئِلَ عَامِرٌ: أَيُصَلَّى عَلَى الشَّهِيدِ؟" قَالَ: أَحَقُّ مَنْ صُلِّيَ عَلَيْهِ الشَّهِيدُ
english_text: Waki' narrated to us, he said: Sufyan narrated to us, from Jabir, who said: 'Amir was asked: "Is the prayer offered for the martyr?" He said: "The one most deserving of being prayed over is the martyr."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ -> سُفْيَانُ -> جَابِرٍ -> عَامِرٌ
narrators_en: Waki' -> Sufyan -> Jabir -> 'Amir

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، قَالَ: ثنا إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنِ الشَّيْبَانِيِّ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنِي عَمْرُو بْنُ أَبِي قُرَّةَ، قَالَ: جَاءَنَا كِتَابُ عُمَرَ بْنِ الْخَطَّابِ أَنَّ نَاسًا، يَأْخُذُونَ مِنْ هَذَا الْمَالِ يُجَاهِدُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ، ثُمَّ يُخَالِفُونَ وَلَا يُجَاهِدُونَ، فَمَنْ فَعَلَ ذَلِكَ مِنْهُمْ، فَنَحْنُ أَحَقُّ بِمَالِهِ حَتَّى نَأْخُذَ مِنْهُ مَا أَخَذَ، قَالَ إِسْحَاقُ: فَقُمْتُ إِلَى أَسَدِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو فَقُلْتُ: أَلَا تَرَى إِلَى مَا حَدَّثَنِي بِهِ عَمْرُو بْنُ أَبِي قُرَّةَ وَحَدَّثْتُ بِهِ؟ فَقَالَ: صَدَقَ، جَاءَ بِهِ كِتَابُ عُمَرَ
english_text: Abu Usamah narrated to us, he said: Ishaq bin Sulayman narrated to us, from Al-Shaibani, from his father, who said: Amr bin Abi Qurrah narrated to me, saying: "A letter from Umar bin Al-Khattab came to us stating that some people take from this money to fight in the way of Allah, then they do not go forth and fight. So whoever among them does that, we are more entitled to his wealth until we take back from him what he took." Ishaq said: So I went to Asad bin Amr and said: "Do you not see what Amr bin Abi Qurrah narrated to me, and what I narrated?" He said: "He spoke the truth, Umar's letter brought it."
narrators_ar: أَبُو أُسَامَةَ -> إِسْحَاقُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ -> الشَّيْبَانِيِّ -> أَبِيهِ -> عَمْرُو بْنُ أَبِي قُرَّةَ -> عُمَرَ بْنِ الْخَطَّابِ -> إِسْحَاقُ -> أَسَدِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو
narrators_en: Abu Usamah -> Ishaq bin Sulayman -> Al-Shaibani -> His Father -> Amr bin Abi Qurrah -> Umar bin Al-Khattab -> Ishaq -> Asad bin Amr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مَعْنُ بْنُ عِيسَى، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي ذِئْبٍ، عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ، قَالَ: يُوقَفُ مَالُ الْأَسِيرِ وَامْرَأَتُهُ حَتَّى يُسْلِمَا أَوْ يَمُوتَا
english_text: Ma'n bin Isa narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Dhi'b, from Al-Zuhri, who said: "The wealth of the prisoner and his wife are withheld until they embrace Islam or die."
narrators_ar: مَعْنُ بْنُ عِيسَى -> ابْنِ أَبِي ذِئْبٍ -> الزُّهْرِيِّ
narrators_en: Ma'n bin Isa -> Ibn Abi Dhi'b -> Al-Zuhri
